text: The first time I went to Flemmings was a few months ago in Glendale. We went with some friends for 5 6 before 7. My wife and I thought I was pretty good. We had bought some gift cards at Costco and got some more gift cards as a gift and had intended to visit the Flemmings in chandler My wife snd I went here this week to celebrate our 3 year anniversary.  The only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is because of the atmosphere.  It was very loud. So loud the waiter had to talk even louder and I could still barely hear him. 2 things I noticed that caused this situation was 1 the music in the restaurant was loud and more pop style (It could have been any style of music) and 2 the seating.  Not that full of a night but everyone was seated close together and that makes it so everyone had to talk louder.  Our waiter was just fine and the food was really good. Still though for the price of it I don't want to feel like I'm at a normal family restaurant where I expect it to be loud. My wife and I decided that we would do the specials before dinner time but not eat dinner here again
Excellent food, top-notch service, exorbitantly priced.  Not for budget minded diners...

Had the NY  strip, green beans, Mac & cheese and key lime pie. Out of a group of four that shared the same side dishes, I ended up getting food poisoning! Three days later and I'm still feeling the effects and lost six pounds too! I will not be going back... Diner beware!

Sunday night prime rib special is amazing!  Comes with salad, side dish, and dessert!  This prime rib was the best I think I have had!  Usually when you order it rare to mid rare it can be a little tough or chewy, but this prime rib melted in my mouth!  There were four of us, we all ordered the same special with different sides so we all could share...highly recommend it!

Love this place. Steak and lobster...what could be better?  The food is always consistent, the service is attentive and thorough. Clearly ranking among the best if not THE best steakhouse in the Chandler area.  The happy hour bar area is nice as an alternative and they have the full menu available as well.  Used to come here as a special occasion place but it has now established itself in my general rotation of high quality nights on the town.

My husband and I ate here for our anniversary.  We had the peppercorn steak, Flemings Potatoes, and a salad.  The food was good but not great. I think we could have split the steak and potatoes and ordered our own salad. We also had two beers and one drink. I ordered a cheesecake to go and they forgot the sauce that went with the cheesecake.  Our bill came to $133.00. Now I'm not sure what part of that experience was worth what we paid. There wasn't anything about the food or the experience that was that spectacular.

Amazing food, customer service and atmosphere.  We eat here at least twice a month with zero disappointment.  Today was outstanding. The perfect dining experience. Ill have to blame that on Brittany.  She was attentive, on point and spectacular at customer service and the cooked had her back by cooking us perfect burgers. She suggested the perfect drink and treated us as if we were her friends and she was our hostess.  And if course i had the best company in the house. Thanks Flemings for having us tonight. Doesn't matter if we are dressed up or dressed down we always get the great service

This was the second time I've been to Fleming's. Both times have been very enjoyable. This time, a friend told me about a bar special called 5 for 6 'til 7. It is five menu items (mixed drinks, wine, appetisers, etc. for $6 until 7 P.M.). You can still order off the menu, but the specials are only available in the bar, and tables are available in the bar area. Everything we ordered was excellent. I had the steak sandwich (another bar special), which was terrific. If you are a wine drinker, don't go to Fleming's if you are thirsty. The amount of wine they serve (a friend ordered a glass of Merlot) for $6 is ridiculous. They bring a huge glass for the wine, and a little carafe of wine, barely enough to wet the inside of the glass. Stick with the mixed drinks or beer. For you beer drinkers, beer is only available in bottles. No beer on tap, which is a shame for a restaurant of this caliber. Hopefully, when the economy improves, Fleming's will continue with some kind of specials, like the 5 for 6 'til 7.

Our group of six ate there on a Friday night.  We had steak, fish, scallops and many sides and salads.  We all agreed we were completely disappointed with the food.  Our bill was around 450 (we didn't have any alcoholic beverages) and we could have gotten better meals for less than half the price.  Service was decent.  Save your money.

Consistently good and constantly packed chain. As usual a little noisy but nice atmosphere if you like a higher energy feel. Had the clam chowder at 13.95 a bowl with a ton of the bread, which is served with 2 great flavored butters (cheesy). Chowder was was very good, not overly rich with cream like some places. Had the 12 oz filet medium rare with the fleming potatoes (yum!), Brussel sprouts, and some shoestring potatoes (very crispy).Everything was great, with the steak done perfectly.Of course at these prices you should expect that. I have had the chocolate lava dessert before, but this time shared the carrot cake for dessert, both are excellent. Another nice prime steak dining experience.

This is just about as good as it gets!  When we went for dinner at about five o'clock, the place was nearly empty, so we did not incur the dreaded wait.  After being seated, our waiter politely introduced himself and asked for our beverage orders.  Our beverages were out in under two minutes and the waiter was more than willing to offer helpful recommendations about what was best on the menu.  I decided to go with the New York Strip cooked medium rare with garlic mashed potatoes and a Caesar salad.  The steak was impeccable, with every bite melting in my mouth.  The Caesar salad was about as good as a Caesar gets, and the garlic mashed potatoes were exploding with flavor.  For dessert, I decided upon the lava cake, which I did not share.  The lava cake was so amazing that I felt compelled to share information regarding its goodness with everyone at the table!    The atmosphere in this place is relaxing, the food is unbelievable, and the service is fantastic!

New Year's Eve reservations were made well in advance, but when we got there on time, the lobby was packed, people were lined up waiting, and the bar had no seating. We were told when we checked in that previous customers decided to linger and so the wait time would be about 20 mins to half an hour and that we could order a drink in the bar lounge while we waited.  Well there was absolutely no room in the bar  or anywhere else to wait, so we waited for about 20 mins lined up against a wall in the pathway of waitstaff.  People just kept  coming and waiting and waiting and waiting. If Flemings is going to take reservations, they need to honor that and not greedily overbook so that there are so many people waiting in the lobby that there is no breathing room.  I'm sure that they have done New Years Eve before and should be able to guess pretty accurately how many reservations to take. Otherwise, they should be honest and say, sorry we don't take reservations and it is on a first come serve basis so that people can plan for that. Management is really not concerned with how customers view this restaurant. Management is really not concerned with how customers view this restaurant since the manager didn't acknowledge the problem when we spoke to him  or apologize or do anything else. We used to think Fleming was a pretty good restaurant,  but we don't plan to go there again or recommend others to go there or take our out of town guests there.  It's the principle of the thing. People will hear about our experience there as we are always asked about where to eat. A word of advice to the management.  Customer service IS very important to the survival of any business.

Overall the experience was pleasant and I would give them 3, if not 4 stars...  However, they failed to accommodate my simple request, which was to pay the bill for the entire table (my family and our guests)....  For some reason, it was so hard for them to honor my request even though I approached them twice.   My guests ended up paying for their own meal.... unbelievable...

We have been here a few times and the staff is always great. The food is good, and the chocolate lava cake is the best dessert i have ever had. We never have to wait, the servers are knowledgable and ready to reccomend based on our taste, and the drinks are excellent. Try the ruby slipper, the martinis or the peach sparkler. Great service and a great atmosphere and happy hour is totally worth it. The lobster is the best in town.

Not really impressed.     Waitress was very goog . place was to noisy service slowGood place to eat if you are not in a hurry. I might be back  45 - 50 dollars for steak only is a bit much for me, no extras bake potato 11 dollars to much for me. French fries 10 where is the nearest mickey dees.

Excellent resturant. Fabulous steaks.  Great service. Good wine selection.  Excellent place to celebrate an important event.  Every time I've been here the service has been excellent.  The atmosphere is formal, but not stuffy.

I love this place. We always have good meals (or happy hour visits). Tonight we went to celebrate my husband's new job. We didn't go all out. But we were still treated well. That's important to us. We don't like being treated one way when we spend big bucks and another when we don't. Anyway, we had the Sunday prime rib special - an awesome deal - and bottle of wine. Our waiter was friendly and attentive but not overbearing. The pacing of our meal was good, too. Ooh, and I love the new version of the wedge salad. The tomatoes and pork belly (rather than thin bacon) were amazing.   My favorites dishes: prime rib, filet mignon, ahi tuna (small plate typically) and various specials.  Appetizers/happy hour: tenderloin carpaccio and calamari. The prime burger is awesome.  Salads: wedge and Flemings.  Sides: mac & cheese, Brussels sprouts, spinach, Fleming potatoes and asparagus.  Desserts: creme brûlée, carrot cake and chocolate lava cake.  Cocktails: blueberry lemon drop, peach whiskey martini, blackberry bramble and farmers daughter. Also, ward b or 8, but I didn't notice it this visit.  Looking forward to another visit soon.

My boyfriend and I went here for our 3 year Anniversary. This was my first time dining at Fleming's so I was excited. The atmosphere was absolutely perfect. We had a reservation so we walked in and was greeted with an Anniversary card that was signed by the staff! Unbelievable! We get seated and order our drinks and meal. The service was spectacular! The food is amazing. Everything was perfect to make our night so special. The manager came to our table to greet us and wished us a Happy Anniversary. My boyfriend asked a question about his meal and noticed they left off the bacon on his steak. No big deal but the manager took care of it immediately. After we finished our meal, we got our check and our waiter gave us a $50 gift card and some gourmet chocolate! We could not believe it. Our experience was unforgettable and we plan to go back very soon! Service goes a long way and they nailed it!

I came here with my husband for a special occasion and found the food to be just ok and the service was terrible. The waiter didn't want to be there and should not have been. I heard good things about this place so we checked it out but I will not recommend it nor will we go here again.
I use to visit another steak house downtown Chandler until I found Flemmings. Staff have gone above and beyond. Love this place

Superb service! The food wasn't too bad either...  We ordered the spicy chili calamari. A little sweet, a little spicy...but just perfect!  Followed that up with the Main steak and a side of Fleming's potatoes (extra cheesy with jalapeños) and the specialty Parmesan crusted halibut topped with lump crab in a lemon/butter/cream sauce over sautéed spinach....DELISH!  Because it was my fiancé's bday we ordered the lava cake. Takes 20 min to make but soooo worth the wait! Request to have Alan as your server - he's on point!

I'm a fan is because the service here is excellent. The servers are helpful but not overbearing (i.e. asking every 5 mins if we need anything) and if anything goes wrong - i.e. it starts raining while you're on the pation or the food is served incorrectly, the management staff is EXCELLENT in making sure you're happy.  Of course, this place is pricey but definitely worth the $.Good food, great wine and terrific servers, bartenders and managers.

Best tuna appetizer I have ever had.  The spicy mustard is out of this world.  When they have a corn/seafood chowder on the menu it is the best chowder you can buy.  Steaks are always great and when halibut is in season they do a terrific job.  Sides are very good.  Especially like the Flemings potatos.  When they have Beef Flemington on the menu it is also top notch.  Prices are high and worth it.

Wow! This Steak House is Awesome. My husband and I decided to Celebrate our Anniversary here. We both enjoyed our server "Cody", he was very friendly and had great knowledge of the menu. Our Steaks were cooked perfectly. The wine recommended by our server tasted exactly the way he described "fresh and crisp". I'm happy that my awesome husband made reservations because there was a pretty big crowd waiting for a table so if you plan on going here  reserve a table ahead of time.  Thanks for a great experience we will definitely be coming back.

Can't understand how this location isn't 4 stars plus. They never disappoint and last night was no exception. Took my daughter for a nice dinner and everything was perfectly prepared, from the salads, to the prime NY Strip.  The service, as always was impeccable. Jurgen our waiter took good care of us and his colleague remembered my daughter and I - from our visit - two years ago.    In previous dinners with the wife and/or friends we've sampled virtually everything on the menu and never left unsatisfied. If you live in the SE Valley, save yourself a trip to Scottsdale for a special occasion and come here.

My husband brought me to Flemings on my birthday. The staff were lovely, all wishing me a 'Happy Birthday' which was a nice touch. The food itself was great. I found a lovely wine on their great wine list and my husband went with a wine recommended by the server which he enjoyed. We both had steak which was cooked as requested and to perfection. If I was to be picky, I would say the side dish of fries I had did not justify the $10 price charge. For dessert I had cheesecake which is the best I've had in a long, long time. Again the staff recognised my birthday and the cheesecake had a candle on it. When we were paying the bill I was given a lovely box of truffles and a gift voucher. Yes, it is expensive but if you have an event you are celebrating they do go that extra yard to make it a memorable occasion for you :-)

flemings is always top notch. we went for the thursday night wine tasting 20 wines for $25 introducing there new 100 wines by the glass. The selection was good from lite whites to deep reds a great way to sample a portion of there new wine list. then to top it off we received $25 gift cards for dinner. so we stayed and had the AZ resturant week pre fix dinner for $39 the food was wonderful. salads, soup lamb chops and filet. i guess to sum it up you can't go wrong with a meal from flemings. they also have a great happy hour.

I went here as part of a business dinner and thoroughly enjoyed myself.  The service was excellent; professional and attentive, without being stuffy or pretentious.  The appetizers, salads, and sides were above average in taste and presentation.  Now, the filet mignon was the highlight of the evening.  The steak was cooked to medium-rare perfection.  If you enjoy a good steak paired with an excellent wine (they have a huge wine list), you should definitely give Fleming's a try.  I'm an out of towner who travels frequently to Chandler and this restaurant tops my list.

Well, the food is absolutely incredible, but the 165$ pricetag for dinner for two was a LITTLE much. The wine we had was great and we both got the surf and turf... with filet mignon of course. I would definately go there again... when I save up some money... Not a place for teachers to go. :)

INCREDIBLE! Absolutely worth every star every penny everything was just on point from the moment you park to the time your finishing up. Flemings made our special event just amazing and i couldnt thank them enough! The WAGYU and the ribeye are what you dream about when youre craving a steak. Ive personally never had WaGyu and was eager to try. Come celebrate a special night at flemings and you will be glad you did!! Thanks again from the Valenzuela family.

Had a fillet - was as good as any I've every had.  Tender, cooked to perfect temperature.  Terrific flavor.  Seafood chowder was good as far as Arizona goes.  You just don't get great chowder here.  Waitstaff was attentive, but otherwise invisible, which is exactly how I like them.    Eating here is different that most places.  Ignore the prices, I would say even ignore the menu.  Tell the waitstaff what you want, they will bring it and charge you what it costs.    If you are price shopping this place, you will not be satisfied.

Went out for our wedding anniversary and decided to give this location a try. Have dined at Fleming's in other states before and always enjoyed ourselves. 1st big plus is we had a reservation and our table was actually ready. Nothing irks me more than making a reservation and still having to wait 20 minutes for a table.   Service was very good. Our server Megan was very nice and knowledgable. She even called over the manager / sommelier to answer my questions about the wine list.   Food was great. My wife had the small plate scallops and they were outstanding. I had the pris fixe menu petite filet and salmon with the chili lime shrimp appetizer. Also very good and very filling. We finished with the chocolate lava cake. I'm not really a dessert guy, but it was worth it.   The only thing that keeps me from giving this location 5 stars is the bar & happy hour. The bar is very small and absolutely packed every night. Since you can only take advantage of the happy hour specials in the bar it becomes a regular mob scene by 5:00. Management needs to seriously rethink the logistics on this. They're sending a lot of potential customers next door to Roy's and the Sandbar due to poor planning.   All in all a very good experience. We'll be back.
Service was good. however, my fillet mignon was cooked well done when I ordered medium well.

Flemings can be a homerun restaurant or it can be in a slump.  Tonight was a slump.  Prime Rib was fine.  Potatoes were okay.  Asparagus was below average.  Bread was slightly dry and tasteless.  Crème Bruelle was great, but the berries looked worn out.  Had a reservation for a booth....younger manager placed us at a table in the middle of the restaurant since it was first come, first serve for seating according to him.  We were puzzled.  There were lots of tables along the walls, but we got the table in the center.  It was loud.  With that being said, I think eating a 5 pm is a good idea if you need a booth for privacy and quietness.  Next, do not eat their specials.  They are average.  Order off the main menu.  Last, the Chocolate Volcano cake is average.  It is not worth the extra time or money.  If in doubt about where you are seated, get up and leave.  We will do that next time.  Why make a reservation if the requests are ignored?  Tonight was an average meal at a noisy restaurant.  I can get that at Outback for less money and their quality is often better than Flemings!

Had reservations for 8. Guess what..no table ready till 8:15.  Got stuck in Coffin corner. Girl friends steak came out raw..she wanted medium.  Bummer. Waiter was okay but I expected a more low key guy considering the venue. Pains me to say it was a disappointment.
Love their Beef Flemington, good poor on wine, good wine selection, good martini's.  Great place to go.

First time going to Flemings and was hoping for a great experience. Unfortunately it felt like the worse financial expenditure in my life. The atmosphere was clean and elegant but the very loud and made it even hard to communicate with our server. Most of us had Chefs Special which was a filet, scallops, and shrimp. Sounds great right. Well the shrimp was tough and the scallops soft and bland more boiled than seared and the steak was well cooked but all was served warm to cold. I love small portions when every bite is exquisite but for mediocre and high prices you might as well serve a larger portion to ensure your guests at least paid for something of substance.   I never plan to return and next time I choose a steakhouse we plan on returning to the Keg. Better atmosphere, service, quality, quantity, and price. Overall a much better value then the over priced Flemings. Next time i will sit at the bar and try one of their burgers instead. I have the review 2 stars because the chipotle Mac and cheese was awesome and the carpaccio was to kill for. Everything else specifically the main courses was money down the drain.

5 stars pretty much speaks for itself and Flemings reputation as a prime steak house is well known, so the reason we're writing this review is to shout out that their free range lemon-rosemary brick chicken is absolutely fantastic!  One of the best entrees we've ever had.  Now it's hard to go to a steak house and order anything but steak but this particular dish is worth the sacrifice.  A full half of chicken beautifully grilled and surrounded by a dozen or more mouth-watering spinach gnocchi.  Everything was wonderful, from the bread & spreads to the creme brulee, but the star of the night was the free range chicken.

My group of three did the Sunday prime rib special, which includes a salad, side, and dessert. Particularly noteworthy items we tried were the bread, Caesar salad, sauteed mushrooms, cheesecake, and creme brulee.  The steaks were ordered three different ways, and all of them came out perfectly.  The hostess and servers did an excellent job in making us feel welcome and special. As someone else noted, they swap out the white napkins for black ones if your slacks or skirt are dark.  The only reason I'm not a regular diner at Fleming's is the price. It is an expensive meal, so it is a place reserved for special occasions. Thankfully, the experience is so outstanding that it justifies the cost.

My favorite dish is the bone-in ribeye for 2. It's a special that you have to ask for and it's usually available. The Fleming's potatoes are delicious, and the lava cake dessert is a great ending to a great meal. The wine selection is also very good.

The food here is great. If I was rating on the food alone it would be five stars.  The service, not so great. The hostess stand was really disorganized. We had reservations, but when we walked in there was one girl at the desk refusing to make eye contact with us or the other couple that was waiting. There were two other girls behind her but they were busy talking about whether or not to post something on facebook (really? we can hear you).  Finally the first girl looks up and says she'll be right with us. Back to staring at her computer screen. More waiting.  Once we were at the table, the server was nice, he just took a very long time to do everything. It was about 15 minutes before anyone came to our table to greet us (which at the price point of Fleming's is ridiculous) and even then it wasn't our server, it was someone else who just dropped off water glasses and said that our server would be there shortly. That was about the pace of everything else. My date and I can usually pass the time very easily but there were points where it was getting so awkward waiting for the server to show up when we could see him aimlessly wandering throughout the restaurant (yes, aimlessly, not actually doing something, I used to work in the industry, I can tell the difference between someone who is legitimately slammed and someone who is just dazed and confused).  Again, two stars because the food was SO good. Not only for dinner that night but there was so much that I had a fabulous lunch the next day as well. But really for the whole experience go to Maestros or Capital Grille.

I've done every prime steakhouse in the Valley (Morton's, Donovan's, Mastro's, etc) ordering the same cut each time ... Boneless ribeye, medium rare. Flemings won hands down. Service is impeccable and when you are a regular, you are remembered and treated accordingly. My favorite restaurant.

We celebrated my sons birthday. The lobster tails were out of this world. One of the best meals we have ever eaten, it was a little more pricey than I had expected but the overall experience was fabulous. I will return for special occasions.

Probably the best out of the large steak chains. Better than Ruth's Chris or Mortons hands down. The filet is amazing. They could have better sides, but let's face it, we go for the steak. We go at least two to three times a year. The customer service (wait staff and managers) are 5 STAR service. They keep us coming back. Personally my favorite steak house for high end.

I'm not that pleased with this experience. For the price, I expected better ambiance and better presentation. The steaks were seasoned and cooked well. Our family enjoys a good cut that's perfectly done to each person's speculations. Also the service was perfect. Our server was thoughtful and attentive, without overly interrupting when we didn't need anything. However, for the high price of everything (not just the steaks) on the menu, we would've expected the place to feel more exclusive, more fancy, not so loud. It felt like a nice bar rather than a fine dining establishment. We had to shout over the noise and the place wasn't even totally full (Sunday evening). The plates were also nothing special to look at. Again because of the price, we expected a few frills. The meat and separate sides came out just plainly put onto plates. No effort was put into the presentation. Even casual restaurants throw some greens or garnishes on the dish for a little extra aesthetic. Probably won't return. If I'm paying this much, I'd like to feel a little more pampered.

My husband and I dined here about a month ago and we were disappointed with our meals.  I wanted to say something and my husband told me not to. But it has been bugging me ever since because we did spend a few hundred dollars here.  We definitely don't mind spending money on really good food, however, not for something that was sub par.  My rib eye steak was so fatty I was spitting out fat in every bite. I know rib eye steak is a fattier piece of steak, however, not in every bite! My husband's lobster was dry and tough. I have been telling all my friends and family about our experience letting them know that the food is not worth the price.  I keep wondering if people just go there because it's supposedly "upscale"-- I say not.

5 Stars across the board. Made the reservation online for a small celebration for a 60th Wedding Anniversary for 4 people. We were running late and called the restaurant twice to change our reservation times; Jessica and Gabrielle were very accommodating and took care of it immediately. The valet Matthew was outstanding. We got seated right away with the awesome Jason and Julia waiting on us. The Calamari, Mushroom Ravioli and Crab Cakes were amazing. Jason recommended a  Merlot from their iPad wine list and it was great. The New England Clam Chowder and the Caesar Salads with the anchovies were fresh and tasty. Bread was warm and replenished right away.  Entrees were cooked perfectly with juicy NY strip steaks  and big scallops, served hot. The side garlic mashed potatoes were delicious. For dessert we got the Creme Brule with the chantilly cream and it was to die for. The manager Bruce stopped by to wish the anniversary couple and see how we were doing, and our waiter presented the couple of the evening with a box of truffles and a $25 gift card, which was a very nice and classy touch. Great ambiance, fantastic food and wonderful attentive service. I have eaten at the Scottsdale location and this one is just better and warmer. Thank you so much.
Very comparable service to other locations I've been to. No complaints, great service, and delicious food. We went on Thanksgiving since it's just my husband and I, and it was packed!
Love this place! Just went here and ordered the petite filet and lobster tail, everything is so good here. I also love the pork chop! My favorite dessert is the lava cake hot and yummy.

I would have given it less but they did comp our bad meal. Ordered filet with crab stuffed prawns and the stuffing tasted like it had been left out. The manager (who never gave her name) tried to tell me that they where fine to eat. They really undercooked my husbands steak and desert was served in a very dirty bowl.  We went in because we had gift cards. I guess we will be giving it another try.

My mother and I love Fleming's happy hour menu, great food and drinks at a reasonable price.  We usually start our mother/daughter fun outing nights at Fleming's before going to the movies or to an event together.  I've equally enjoyed their dinner menu while celebrating birthdays or while on a date night. I highly recommend their filet Mignon and any of their side dishes. If you visit during their happy hour, get the burger and any one of their martini's.

While the steak was amazing it was my least favorite part of the meal. The cold seafood starter was the best I've had in Arizona. The salad and sides were so delicious I couldn't stop eating them even after I was full. Wine and champagne were the best I've had.   But who am I kidding. Lava. Cake. I would go back just for dessert. We had to fight for the last gooey bite!  The staff is high end, attentive, professional, and polite.

My hubby and I ate here earlier tonight. We made an early (5pm) reservation so we could squeeze in a movie post dinner. Since they open at 5, we figured we would be the first people inside. Much to our surprise it was packed with happy hour patrons. It must be a good one, so we will come back another time to try it.  Leave it to us, though, to dine at a steakhouse and both order seafood. I had the lobster tails and they were amazing. My hubby enjoyed his salmon and said it was some of the best he had ever had. We also had asparagus and the Flemings potatoes. Both were great!   Service was impeccable. We will definitely go back for seconds ;)

Went there for our anniversary and was very pleased! The food was terrific as well as the mixed drinks! We got a peach cocktail and it tasted delicious! We both got an 8 ounce sirloin along with a baked potato and it was awesome! The baked potato definitely sealed the deal!  The manager came over and gave us some truffles to take home along with a gift card for our anniversary! It is expensive but very nice and romantic for a special occasion! Really awesome!

This place has gone downhill big time! 2 attempts at a medium rare steak resulted in one overcooked to well, the last being rare with a cold, cold center. Basically, they seared the last one!  I guess the Costco gift cards, etc has relegated this steakhouse to mediocrity. Welcome to Chandler!

Very upscale and nice. Valet only on weekends and the food is great. The bartender remembers me even if I havent been in months. The steak and seafood tower are the best. Expect to spend some money here.
The food here is great with a nice atmosphere! A great place for a very nice dinner. A nice place to have in my own back yard of chandler and not having to drive to Scottsdale for the same quality.

My wife and I like this place. A lot.  Most people know about their happy hour, it is one of the best around.  Make sure you get on their email list. Some of their "off menu" specials are a good excuse to have a fun night out.  Friendly service and really good food and wine. This place is always a good choice for dinner. Steak, lobster, scallops, cooked to perfection or they will certainly make it right.  Cheers!

This a review highlighting Flemings Event hosting skills-  I had a luncheon/seminar here on yesterday and was thoroughly impressed with both the outstanding quality of food and excellent service. Flemings was closed to the public during this event because they open at dinner hours. Although the restaurant was not officially opened all of the employees still kept the same level of service as if it was; as a matter of fact I was graciously greeted by a hostess upon arrival. The actual meeting room was sectioned off in the rear of the restaurant, this would make a great place for any after wedding rehearsal dinner, seminar/luncheon, or even possibly an upscale bridal shower. The wait staff was very friendly moved stealthily to each table during the seminar which is very important (nobody wants to hear a bunch of plates clinking when you're trying to listen to a presentation). On to the food! The salad was pre-chosen by the host which was Fresh Mozzarella & Sweet Cherry Tomato- one word to describe it would be "AMAZING"! The tomatoes were perfectly sweet and paired so well with the creamy FRESH mozzarella, I literally thought about this dish when I was on my way to sleep for the night. For dinner attendees at the seminar had the choice of chicken, salmon and of course steak. My co-workers and I all decided to try something different so we could compare. I had the Chicken and was impressed by juiciness and the mushroom chutney it was served with. The Salmon looked delectable and received high praise as well as the Petite Filet Mignon. All the entrees came with fresh Sautéed Green Beans and Fleming's Potatoes (think of the best scallops you've ever eaten, now times that greatness by 10 and you'll have Fleming's Potatoes).  The seminar concluded with a Cheesecake that was sent straight from the Cheesecake gods (it was a huge piece and I was already full but I somehow made room for it!). The Cheesecake was rich, creamy and lightly topped with blueberries (I can't believe I had to go back to work after that feast!). This was my first time at Fleming's I will be sure to come back during normal operating hours so I can try even more of the amazing menu. Bravo Chef and Staff!

First off, they didn't offer us the restaurant week menu.. lost a star for that.   After hearing such good things about this place my lady I decided to check it out.   1.) Took at least 15mins for our waiter to come introduce himself. 2.) Not a fun atmosphere at all. The booths we sat in felt like we were on display and far from comfortable. 3.) Calamari was awesome, enjoyed that very much win for them. 4.) When the food eventually came out I said to myself, "this is going to amazing!!" I mean it had to be, the presentation was on point like Ruth's Chris or Mastro's and it smelled great. I was wrong so very wrong. I don't think this restaurant believes in flavor. 1 steak was severely undercooked and 1 steak was over cooked and tough.  5.) The sides-- the mac and cheese was close but no cigar. The twice cut fries looked and smelled good but tasted like sonic fries with zero salt. 6.) Our free dessert lacked luster and the expensive ass food was anything but spectacular. I need to go back to Mastro's and have the butter cake  My advice if you're looking for a really good meal go to Ruth,s Mastro's, or Steak 44 this place is weak.

Ask for Jurgen (like the Jergen lotion)  Reservations were easy, got the time we wanted.  My husband and I went for my birthday, we were greeted and seated with a signed birthday card, nice touch.  We had a few minutes to look at the menu then we were greeted by our server Jurgen.  Asked us what to drink, we wanted a bottle of red wine and made a wonderful recommendation.  Brought water and delicious sourdough bread and a couple of different butters (very tasty and rich!)  My husband loves salads but Jurgen recommended the clam chowder.  We got both and split them!  The salad was pretty good but the clam chowder was to DIE FOR!!!  Perfectly seasoned.  We both ordered steaks, with rubs, their potatoes and the Brussel sprouts.  All fabulous!  My husband didn't realize that a sauce came ON his steak.  He's not a sauce guy so we mentioned it to Jurgen so the manager came over.  We weren't complaining but the manager asked if my husband wanted another steak, no questions, over sauce!  Amazing.  He said no, but we got dessert for free instead.  Really?  Yes!  What a way to stand behind your product.  The other manager stopped by as well, just to check on us and chat for a minute and to wish me a happy birthday.  The gal that was taking care of us as well was very attentive but not overbearing.  She impressed us also.  Though it was expensive it was so worth it.  Oh, did I mention Jurgen gave us truffles as well?  What a fabulous meal.  We will definitely go back for the next special occasion.

Service was slow, never got bread, and the halibut special wasn't anything to brag about.  Halibut never really tastes fishy but when you cover it up with a weird white sauce and throw crab on it you might as well put cod on the plate.  Just not what you would expect from a $100+ dollar meal.  Check out the flemmings potatoes though.  It's a glimmer of hope, even though an extremely small portion for a "family style" portion.

Super pricey, great cuts of meat, steaks cooked perfectly. Dress is casual.  Valet parking service is great!    Expect to pay about $50 per person before drinks.    We have 4 drinks.  2 filets and 2 sides, $225 later we walked out stuffed

My wife and I recently went to Flemings for her birthday.  Anytime we decide to spend a bit more on a nice dinner Flemings is our first choice.  You know every time you go there you will receive first rate service and 5 star food.  There is not a bad item on the menu there and the steaks are fantastic.    The only thing I would say the location lacks is the bar.  While they do have one, it is very small and gets full quite quickly.  We would love to go there more to enjoy some of the food on the happy hour menu but given how it is set up, we opt for other locations.  The dining room itself is very spacious and representative of a high end dining experience.    One thing that always cracks me up there is how they offer to carry my drink for me when walking me to be seated in the dining room.  May have to actually do that sometime....

We went for a date night with my boyfriend on a Monday night. It was much fancier than I had anticipated. I felt a little under dressed in jeans and flip flops. We had zoe as our server and she was great. We ordered the sea bass, the filet and the flemings potatoes. Everything tasted great but I thought the filet portion was a little small.

Let me begin by saying I'm usually a huge fan of Fleming's. I've gone to the Scottsdale and Lincoln location quite a few times, and have received nothing but stellar service each of those visits. Tonight, I cannot say the same about the Chandler location.   Let's begin by Brittany (our server) coming to take our drink orders... It took close to 20 minutes (18 to be exact) to receive our drinks. We hadn't seen our server and was wondering where she had went, so we had asked a near by server if he can find out where Brittany was because our table was ready to order. Long story longer... A girlfriend of mine had ordered a $155 bottle of Caymus, the server had her sample it, and my girlfriend told the server the wine needed to be filtered. Brittany disregard what we had requested and poured it into a glass pitcher (can't think of the name for container she poured the wine in) and never came back. We finally had to tell the young gal that was helping Brittany serve the table we wanted the wine to be filtered because of the sediment. This gal kept challenging us... Stating why didn't we tell Brittany this in the beginning... And we told her we did, but she never came back to do it. Mind you, there was 3/4 of the bottle left, it was not like anyone drank the bottle and demanded anything for free. My boyfriend who is in the restaurant industry... A GM of a restaurant in North Scottsdale would not have let something like this slip without touching the table. No manager came to touch on the table as this was an on-going challenge of the night. This went on for the majority part of our visit until we watched the manager  go into the wine cellar with our other server to grab another bottle we had requested.   Point is, no one touched the table. Despite of the challenge for the night with the wine, you would've at least expect a manager to come by because no one had taken responsibility for such poor service we left quite disappointed... Can't expect a decent tip if you do not receive decent service. I think holding yourself ACCOUNTABLE is a major issue at tonight's visit. No accountability whatsoever. I highly suggest someone in charge reading, 'Leaders Eat Last'. It's a great read on leadership.   Tonight's visit left a really bad taste in my mouth. Very poor service! Brittany did not return to our table as she left it for the other gal to take care of us. I know how intimidating and frustrating it can be to serve, because I myself have served for 5 years while going through college, but at a place like Fleming's I don't see why you cannot be successful when all the tools you need are right in front of you. Being in the service industry isn't for everyone, it takes a lot of patience, and customer service skills. You work in this industry to be of at service to people no matter how bad a night is going.  Do not have any reasons to return.

my filet medium-rare was cooked perfectly, my husband  had filet with  oscar style crab asparagus and Bearnaise sauce.  I thought he was going to lick the plate. Caesar salad and clam chowder to start. probably one of the best experiences and food that I've ever had, absolutely nothing to complain about. our 5 year wedding anniversary was acknowledged several times by the waiter and the floor manager who came around and knew us by name, how awesome for a first-time experience! they also give you dessert which was a molten lava chocolate cake with fresh whipped cream and berries with little vanilla wafers. I almost cried that's how good it tasted. they give you a little box of chocolate truffles that I have yet to try and $25 off your next visit, worth every Penny of. our $250 Bill. a must-try for your special occasion!

My boyfriend and I were celebrating my recent job promotion and our two year anniversary. I must say that the service is what will bring me back again for other celebrations. We had a wonderful server, and were greeted by the manager who congratulated us. The ambiance is very nice for special occasions and anniversaries, however if you wanted to catch the football game or baseball game, you could eat at the bar area. The noise from the bar area does not carry into the fine dining area.   We both ordered a Caesar salad, the filet mignon and lobster tail, and for dessert we shared the chocolate lava cake AND the cheesecake. Their prices are fair - it's a fine dining establishment. The filet mignon was cooked exactly how I wanted it, and the lobster was delicious. Needless to say, I will be looking forward to celebrating at this Fleming's again.

So here's the thing, had dinner here the other night and the food was very good. I'm a little over steaks cooked in a 1600 degree oven though and would love to find a place where they actually cook steaks over wood so you get the nice charred marks.. nonetheless the food is good, especially the sides. However, the sides are ridiculously overpriced. We tried their lobster bisque which was delicious, but $14.95 for a cup of soup? The crab cake appetizer was $19.95, salads and all potato and veggies are all about $12. Yes you can share and again everything we had was very good, but still...yikes.  Speaking of their steaks, I would say if you order the ribeye be sure and inquire as to how thick it is. My ribeye came out not even an inch thick and looked like a steamed breakfast steak. I did turn it back and they were very gracious about it.  I simply shared with my dinner date which was more than enough and it was fine because really the rest of the food was fabulous.  We had great service and notice a number of Captains walk around making sure everything was going smoothly.
We really enjoy going to Flemings's. I have always had great food and a perfectly prepared steak. I really like the atmosphere.

I recently dined here and did not have a good experience. I dine at steakhouses frequently, Hillstone group, capital grille etc. and this place has never been comparable. My filet had no sear, my boyfriends dad's fish was over cooked, the creamed spinach was like soup, burrata was a joke and the sautéed spinach was over salted. There pour on glasses of wine are quite small too, no different ounce options. For the prices, go to Capital Grille! Pretty disappointing, especially the waiter with the southern accent giving us attitude for complaining about the soupy creamed spinach and not wanting to order there chocolate lava cake, lol. Chandler is pretty disappointing with there options of restaurants. Not worth the drive.

We've previously dined here before and had a great time but I guess they've gone downhill since then (or at least this location). There's no valet :( we waited a few min before we were sat at a booth, we let our server know we would need a steak to go and she advised us to order it after we get out meal.We started out with the carpaccio and pork belly, the carpaccio is still the best in town but the pork was dry and underwhelming at best. The salads followed we had the Caesar (great flavor) and Flemings (very bland). This is where the bad starts my husbands NY strip was cooked properly but mine and my friends were not I ordered med rare ( I received med well) my friend ordered med (got med rare) I sent mine back, the server was not happy with that. After 15 min I got my new steak done right, at this point the rest of the table were finished eating so we ordered dessert and reminded our server we wanted a meal to go and our check because we had to leave soon. She seemed very busy and I had to flag down another server to pay our bill, after 25-30 min we finally had our meal and could leave. Bottom line I think next time we want a good steak we'll go to the Scottsdale location or City Hall!

My husband and I are frequent customers of the Chandler location steakhouse.  Normally we have always been satisfied with service and meal.  We usually spend 180.00 - 200.00....  Last week we ordered the King Crab Legs and was terribly disappointed.  The quality was much like what you would get at a casino buffet if not less.   When I complained to, I presumed the Manager, she kindly brought an additional half order to our table and they looked identical to my original order.  It's as though they scraped the bottom of the pot for these sad little legs.  The presentation was horrible.   My husbands rib eye for the first time was not cooked properly and the quality of the beef had so much gristle and way too much marbling there was little left that was palatable.  What's up here!!   We may have to drive into Phoenix or Scottsdale for a quality steak.  Too bad.

Our dinner last night at the Chandler Flemings was excellent. The bacon wrapped filets w/tempura shrimp were cooked to perfection and may become a favorite for us. Whether it's a full dinner or the fabulous bar menu, this place never disappoints.

I have been here three times and all three times the food has been amazing. Usually service is equally amazing but tonight our server was really bad he was un attentive forgot about us while he served other tables with service we usually get. If you go and your server is named Jason. ..move to another area.

New to the area and I stopped in after a long day at work to relax and enjoy a burger. Wow, spectacular food. Service is another why the less than stellar review. I waited standing for 40 minutes for a spot in the bar area and they clearly saved a.spot for someone who came in 15 minutes after I waited. I had asked if anyone was sitting  in the spot he went to and was told yes by the bar staff...not true because I watched the man come in and ask of there was room.at the bar....the spot i asked for was maniacally available...ugh. But still, I am glad I waited. Very rarely do I eat meat... this was perfect and Brandon was a great server.... I'll be back. Only suggestion... bar staff be honest and more personable... kind of nonchalant and for AZ that's normally not the case.

My wife took to me to Flemming's to celebrate my 31st birthday this Wednesday.  What a pleasurable experience we had.  Everyone from the hostess to server to bus boys were extremely nice and inviting.  An example of the service we received can be summed up by this.  They offered to bring me dessert for my birthday, once finding out I was gluten free they provided me with a key lime truffle covered in toasted coconut instead of cake.  Ugh, impressed I was.    The food was remarkable.  Their new Porcini Filet Mignon was out of this world.     Go to Flemming's and enjoy.  The next thing for us to get to is the happy hour.

We had a most enjoyable dinner at Fleming's. The staff was very friendly and polite. The meal was so yummy - I didn't want to stop eating.  The young lady who seated us was very sweet and warm. Mark (our waiter) was helpful and prompt. Conner (who assisted Mark) always kept bread and water on the table- and cleared off dirty plates quickly. The manager came over and checked on us (we told him how well we were being taken care of). We were impressed with the young man who valet parked our car (missed his name). Very friendly and enjoyed chatting with him a few minutes. Of course, compliments to the chefs for the best seabass and mashed potatoes I have ever eaten....the cream brulee was so yummy.  Thanks for a wonderful evening... Your staff is awesome....

I had heard that this was a good fancy restaurant to go to so I took my parents here when they came to visit town and I must say that I was dissappointed. The cost for 3 people was exorbitant for the quality. We are not a family that minds spending a little for excellent food but this meal did not meet the standard for the amount our meal was for three people.  The portions of the appetizers we shared were tiny. I think we had three pieces of ravioli in the ravioli dish which was not much. My steak left a pile of inedible gristle that filled a quarter of my plate and I don't even usually mind a little fat which adds flavour.  It was clearly not edible but the waiter asked me 'aren't you going g to eat that?' 'Uh..that's a no.' For the price I would not go there again. Too expensive for mid level quality. I would prefer somewhere like the keg where I have had far better food at a better value.

I agree with David M and Ada G. regarding the service in the bar. If you go here, do not dine in the bar. The hostess might tell you its full service at the bar but the service at the bar is noticeably lacking. If you have a choice between waiting for a table and eating at the bar, eat at the table.  We were rushed, not all of our food was packed to go, water not refilled without asking (and waiter never apologized for failing to refill drinks), steak knives were not brought with the food, bread was not brought out without asking, had to ask for refill on wine (since when has a waiter not asked for refill on alcoholic drinks)...all of the usual amenities that are provided at table service was severely lacking at the bar.  The other aspect that annoyed me was that I asked for fried onion strings or straws on my steak and asked if they could prepare it. The server immediately got defensive and acted as if I was asking  foie gras on the side. Instead of simply responding with "It shouldn't be a problem, I'll see what we can do" His response was remniscient of a server at Applebees "Well since we don't offer that item on the menu, I just don't know if they can make that" Seriously, was I dining at Black Angus? It's called common sense, I can understand that response if I was asking for something other than fried onion strings. Very amateur to say the least!  The food itself is amazing at this location. They reall cook steaks well and if you order a medium, it comes perfectly cooked with mostly pink inside and just a little charred on the outside. It's one of the few places that really understand what a medium steak is and they don't overcook it like most places.  I like their steaks better than many more well known places including Donovans and Ruth Chris.  The service needs to improve even at the tables. You don't receive that royal treatment like you do at other upscale steak restaurants including Ruth Chris, Donovan's etc. I can understand that type of service if I'm dining at Outback Steakhouse but we just spent $167 for two and were formally and professionally dressed yet we were rushed as if we were eating at Chipotle during lunch rush hour.  The service needs to improve especially for a fine dining establishment. The basics like refilling drinks, smiling, addressing people as sir/mam, apologizing if items are forgotten are basic elements of good service at a fine dining restaurant yet it was lacking here. If you want an example of great service, go to Durants

Came here with a group of 12, we called ahead and they were able to get us sat all together and we didn't have to wait at all. We were able to arrive before our reservation and immediately sit down.   I ordered the dry aged rare rib-eye with asparagus and a Caesar Salad.  Steak was cooked perfectly, and melted in my mouth. I am pretty sure I could cut the steak with a fork and not even chew if I wanted to.   For desert I had the cheesecake and it was your typical New York style cheesecake, was delicious and the right consistency.    Overall the meal was a little pricey, but I did opt for a dry aged steak and full 3 course meal.

Had a terrible experience the first time my husband and I came here. We were treated like we had no money and our card would bounce. Had we not been given a gift card we wouldn't have come back. Mark was our server this time around and was down to earth and didn't talk down to us (my husband has a beard, that doesn't mean we're poor come on look at Duck Dynasty) he made us feel really welcome here and not like we were outcasts. Next time we come we are asking for MARK!

Thursday night..... Busy!  Bartenders never acknowledged us even after looking at us multiple times. I guess they think they make enough money. Cocktail table opened up after 10 minutes. The male cocktail server did a fantastic job in letting us know of specials and his opinions of the wine and apps and taking care of us--kudos!  Dinner table opened up (20 minutes after our reservation but no big deal at all-- busy).  Megan waited on us and was very good too.  EXTREMELY Loud and Noisy inside (I forgot that since its been years since I was back).  Megan did great at explaining recommendations of all the questions we had w/ the food and wine. Only issue on service was they never brought out our 3 sauces we asked for and were part of the meal.  The steaks $57 and $55 each were good but not fantastic at all and not worth $50+. It seems prices increased about 20% since last time there and not worth it for the good but not great food and the wine prices (happy hour has good prices though).  Spending $250 for two was too high for the food quality we got and the very loud ambience.  Service was very good though other than the bt's.  I'll stick w/ Ruth and Chris, Capital One or Maestros in future.

The atmosphere was a little different from what we expected.  It is much more relaxing and casual than the ones we've been to in L.A.  The waiter was very polite and funny at the same time.  He seemed relieved and excited to serve our table since we were the only under 50 table in the whole restaurant.  *Steaks = very yummy.  cooked to perfection.   *Decor = a little on the vintage side *Service = wonderful
Amazing from start to finish. It is very pricey but you truly get what you pay for, delectable and delicious. Great service, food, and wine.
Awesome service. I'm not one for uncomfortable snooty dining, and this restaurant made me feel very relaxed and comfortable. Food was good and well presented

The service at this location is not what one would expect at an upper end steakhouse or any fine dining establishment.  This was my third visit to this location and the service level and attentiveness of the wait staff is not on par with other Fleming's or what it should be for the price point.   Perhaps as one of the few upper end dining options in the area, they just can't get a decent staff since the area is cluttered with chain casual dining restaurants.    This place really needs to try harder and step it up and give people a level of service they expect for what they are paying.

This is the perfect example of an upscale steakhouse. Amazing service, amazing meats and seafood cooked exactly the way you like It, huge sides to share for the table, and desserts that are impossible not to make room for.   Fleming's has always been a go to for special occasions of any kind and they are sure to make you leave feeling special.   Pricey? Yes. Worth It? Yes.

It was okay.  For the price,  I would not go back.  The soup and salad were excellent, the steak was nothing special.  The service was good, but not great.  The support staff was better than the actual server, although the actual server was very nice and friendly.  Finally, and most important, it was LOUD.  I mean if I say I said "what?" once to the person sitting across the table from me I said it 100 times during the meal.  If you are looking for a quiet restaurant to share a nice meal, go to Scottsdale to Ruth Chris.  (I have to say, I am a Ruth Chris fan and went here to try something new).
Get the summer pairing of a filet and salmon with the chile lime prawns-best salmon I've ever had!!
My favorite place to go when we don't want to cook or BBQ ; calamari and burger ate to fast for pictures

My wife and I have gone to this location a few times for our anniversary. It is a wonderful place the staff are always very kind to us and the service is wonderful. The steaks are usually on point and very good cuts all though it seems this time past time it was very average. Maybe the have changed the steaks?? There was no "wow what a great steak" feeling, we both get the aged NY steak medium. Don't get me wrong I'm not trying to knock the place just giving you our review on this particular night Nov. 21st 2016

I have visited a Flemings a few times over the years and I am always satisfied.  I usually go with my husband's family on Sundays to take advantage of their Prime Rib deal.  I always enjoy visiting.  They always have great steaks and amazing sides.  I haven't been for happy hour but I heard it's pretty good.

The prime burger was absolutely amazing! I visited this location on 10/2/2012 with my sister-in-law and parents.  First ever visit ti Fleming's as I live out of state.    The only (2) two complaints that I have: the prime burger is a whooping 1105 calories (and I'm not even sure if this includes the special sauce and the two onion rings that are served on the side). It's my fault I should've asked the server since the caloric intake is not listed on the menu.  Second issue, how many times do you have to ask a server for straws until you get frustrated. Also, wouldn't you think that an empty glass of water means " please fill up my glass". Come on servers this is a high end establishment. Get it together!!!!! Very frustrating!

We came back with other friends. Some things were better, noise, for example.  My prime rib was tough but the rest of the meal was fine. Drinks arrived on schedule or not unreasonably behind schedule.  I like the wine by the glass and was thrilled to find Colby red blend which I love. The dessert I ordered was not delivered but a couple of minutes later was.   My wife had no problems.  A friend ordered coffee with dessert but they had run out so he had to wait.  Waitress was nice but maybe overwhelmed.  Since we had the Sunday night prime rib special the price was high but not larcenous. This is not priced as high as the top steakhouses but shouldn't go higher.  It is not in the same league.

We brought our mothers to Fleming's for Mother's Day. We have been many times in the past and really enjoyed everything- food, wine, service. This time was different as it seems Fleming's has made some changes. I will start with a positive. Our waiter Nathan was fantastic! Very sweet and knowledgeable and took good care of us. All the staff was professional and provided good service.  To start with the rest, they have always had an amazing wine list but for some reason they cut WAY back on the number of choices for a glass of wine. There was not one thing on the glass of wine menu that I was interested in. Three of the salads were great, but one had less than acceptable lettuce on the plate. The onion soup was good.  The top it off lump crab was not good at all! It was very disappointing. The steaks were ok, but nothing like they used to be. I had never had a less than perfect steak there before. Overall, an awfully hefty bill for a meal that did not equal up to that:-(((((

I was kind of surprised that this place wasn't to my expectations, it is really nice inside great Ambience but they had not given their full potential I believe. the waiters were kind of slacking on refilling drinks and asking if there was  Anything else that we needed they had us just waiting around the whole time. The steaks were not that great neither. Maybe it was a bad day

Would love to give this place a better rating, but the initial prime rib both my wife and I received was something a Sizzler would be embarrassed to serve. It was incredibly stringy and tough to the point of being impossible to eat. To their credit, once I complained they brought out two new cuts that were very good. Cooked perfectly and tender although under-seasoned. But it made me wonder about how those initial cuts could get through the quality control process. I mean, they were ridiculously awful.  I thought about it being the $29 prime rib special and that's what they give people and then hope they don't complain, but I don't think they would play with their reputation like that. On the plus side, the Flemings potatoes, bread, salad and cheesecake were awesome, but it's time we try a different steakhouse.

Spent our first wedding anniversary at Fleming's this evening.  This was an impromptu reservation made the same day and we were happy they could accommodate us at such a late notice.  For us, it came simply down to the ambiance.  Jordan, our server was wonderful despite her having to shout over the noise.  So if you are looking for an intimate dinner for two this isn't it.  However, our food was delicious...steak perfectly done, great halibut and Fleming's salad was quite nice.  A glass of an awesome Moscato left no room for dessert but received a token of congratulations for our special day which was beautifully presented and greatly appreciated.  Yep...the prices are high...figure on $45+ per person.  We thought it warranted the price but the ambiance could use a definite boost to cater to a more perhaps private dining experience rather than having to shout to speak to one another.

I needed to submit a receipt to be reimbursed and I looked EVERYWHERE with no luck. I called Flemings and within minutes my original receipt popped in my e-mail. Service at this place its truly impressive.

Okay everyone let's start off with price this is not a place you're going to walk out the door without spending pretty much close to $100 per person  so if that something you consider when you're going out don't eat here. OK enough said about that, the service here is phenomenal excellent wait staff excellent food my wife went here for her birthday and had a great time we stuck to small plates not because we were worried about cost but we like to eat smaller portions and I am NOT one to really go for a $60 steak I do believe that's a bit on the high side. We started off with a spinach salad that was outstanding and I had the soup of the day which was a leek soup which was really one of the best I've ever had for the main course we had a short rib and a shrimp and scallop dish both wonderfully prepared actuall  did have a good bottle of wine and topped off with the creme brulee I understand that there molten lava cake is something to be seen but we're creme brulee fans and it was again perfectly prepared and enough for two the same is true of their side dishes   again the service was outstanding the waiter was attentive without being overly bearing this is a perfect place for an anniversary or birthday it's certainly not going to be your Thursday night steak joint but highly recomend for special treat.

I went to Fleming's again just before Christmas on 12/23 and the service was not up to par. I was disappointed with the hostess' attitude when she scolded us for not being right in the lobby when are name was called. CHECK YOUR ATTITUDE MISSY. We almost left just because of her but the food is still satisfying so we stuck around despite the poor service of the hostess and the "okay' service of the server who forgot to bring us our beer. Still no complaints about the awesome food.

We went for date night on a Saturday evening.  They sat us in the back room which gave us a little bit more privacy, tables are very nicely spaced so you can't hear the next table's conversation and the back room keeps the noise from the main area muffled.  Staff were all very friendly, didn't feel rushed at all.  Food was amazing (though the stakes came out the wrong way round and my partner salted his to death before we noticed this mistake).  We'll be visiting again.

Love, Love, Love Fleming's happy hour!  It is a nice atmosphere with smokin' deals on decent wine and drinks and great appetizers. There is also a very tasty burger on the happy hour menu.  The service is usually excellent.
Great steaks! We had the filet minion last night and it was cooked perfectly! The staff was very nice as well. This is a great place for a nice night out. We will be back for sure!

GREAT food!  We had a Valentine's reservation for 9:45, since that was all that was available.  I called around 8pm to see if we could get a seat earlier.  I was told, " we are booked for the night."  We showed up at 9pm and were seated immediately.  There were MANY empty seats.  I am not sure what the deal was with seating us earlier.  The food was INSANE good.  We each got a filet. We got a backed potato and Fleming's potatoes.  I am not sure why we got them, since we were so stuffed and had to get them to go.  We got the chocolate lava cake for dessert.  It was good, not great.  It tasted burned.  We got the calamari for an appetizer. They were slightly soggy.  The wine was great.  The service was great.  Overall, VERY GOOD.  I will definitely go back!

Pricey but always a great steak!  We came here for a family celebration and even though the place was full of business diners, we received good service.  We started with the chilled seafood tower which while pricey, was excellent.  This was followed by salads and I have to say that I preferred the"old" Wedge versus the New Wedge. The previous Wedge was the best that I have had anywhere and was just the right combination of flavors and crispy iceberg lettuce.  Steaks (Filets and Prime Ribeyes)  were tender, moist, and cooked to perfection.  Personally, I just prefer the high-temperature broiling method that Flemings uses to cook their steaks versus an open-flame/grilling approach. One diner had Seabass which fresh and tender. Sides (grilled asparagus, Fleming's potatoes, and creamed spinach) are always fresh and flavorful and among the best I've had anywhere.  The Raymond Napa Valley Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon was a nice value accompaniment with the steaks.  Crème Brulée was excellent and the Chantilly cream is just sinful.  A great place for special occasion.

I will say this place was awesome. Wait staff was great very friendly. Wished my wife and I a happy 21st anniversary and all. Food was like no other. I had a certified angus prime rib which was out of this world . I would recommend this to anyone who is into great steaks. The appetizer was bacon cover in maple syrup and Jack Daniels which again was awesome. Don't just take my word for it go and try it out you will not be disappointed.

We came here for our 25th anniversary dinner. The atmosphere is pleasant with excellent service. Unfortunately, the food itself was only okay.   They make their food with special twists, like champagne and merlot infused butters with their bread. It's unique and fun to try but the bread itself was nothing special, we would've preferred regular butter with good bread. The Caesar salad has fried capers and prosciutto chips on it. Again, it sounds incredible and was good but nothing I'd crave. Creme Brûlée - ditto although the Chantilly cream was excellent.    I will say our filet mignons were cooked perfectly and served piping hot. My husband didn't prefer the flavor of the seared edges but I thought it was good (not great).   All in all, I wouldn't mind if someone wanted to meet here but I'd probably prefer The Keg.

First of all let me say that the only reason I am not giving this a 5 is a because the bar area is rather small and you have to strategically plan to get here early and scout a seat. I came with my all male Co workers and we had a great time. Drinks were strong, prime rib burger was on point and I definitely plan to come again. I love that the happy hour menu strayed away from the norm, pizza or wings...had a great time but get there early or be prepared to stand around and watch others have a great time

I was visiting town on a business trip and we stopped into Fleming's for a mid-week dinner.  The visit wasn't a complete flop, but close to it...  If the ribeye was in fact a "prime" ribeye, they did one heck of a job cooking all of the flavor out of it.  To mask the horrible grill work, they covered the steak with more salt that was necessary for the entire cow.  I've been lucky enough to dine an a wide array of steak houses that claim to serve "prime" steak, and this is the bottom of the list.  I would not recommend this restaurant for a large group as the atmosphere is quite loud.  We had six people at our table and a conversation that included everyone was not possible.  To end on a positive note, the servers and wait staff were terrific.  They are easily on-par with other prime steakhouses around the country.  Regarding the item on the menu that I enjoyed the most was the sweet chili calamari.

Plan on paying top dollar for your meal, but, you will get your money's worth. Prime steaks and high quality seafood. Service is excellent. Great place for that special occasion. Bar is intimate. Have eaten here numerous times over the years. They have maintained a high level of quality and service during all these stops.
Went in for a quick bite and glass of wine, came out happy. Would be five stars if the glass wine list was better.

Go to place for special occasion.  Just don't count calories.  Expect great    Steaks, extensive wine list, tasty apps and save some room for desert.  Bone in ribeye is one of the best.  Mash is always seasoned perfectly.   Very good service as well.  Only downside is the large bill at the end of the meal.

Having been to Fleming's before, I was really looking forward to tonight's visit to celebrate a special event.  We had a reservation and were seated right away in the dark and fairly crowded room. Our table seemed exceptionally small for our party of four, which made dish and glass placement a little tricky, and during the evening my chair was bumped a few times by the waitstaff and guests because the tables were so close together. We started with crab cakes, slab-cut bacon, and lobster bisque, all of which were quite good.  There was a mix up with my drink order, and even after attempting to correct it, I still received the wrong drink. Then, we waited and waited and waited for our entrees.  3 of the 4 steaks were ordered medium well, 2 of which arrived medium rare.  After the long wait, we were in no hurry to send them back.   Our favorite sides were the chipotle mac and cheese and the Fleming's potatoes, which don't look particularly appetizing when they're served in a rectangular brick, but which tasted fantastic!  We could have passed on the Yukon mashed potatoes and asparagus we ordered as neither were particularly remarkable.    We finished off with creme brulee served with whipped cream and fresh berries, which came out right away and was just as wonderful and creamy  as I remembered it being here.  Overall, the dinner was nice, but it didn't feel quite like the celebration dinner we'd hoped for.

My family comes here regularly. We like to come on Sundays for the prime rib dinner - $40 for prime rib, salad, a side, and dessert. I normally get the Fleming's salad and Fleming's potatoes and then end with the lava cake (so good!). It's a more expensive restaurant, but they have really good steak.

My wife and I met 2 friends at the bar for some happy hour and dinner action last night.  It was about 6:30 and I think we snagged just about the last open table.    I was pretty impressed with their happy hour selections and prices.  The ladies had glasses of wine and the guys had a Kettle martini with blue cheese olives (my absolute fav!).  The martini was excellent especially because it was 6 bucks.  The wine pour was a bit skimpy though.  The 4 of us shared the crab cake appetizer and it was excellent and will definitely order it again.  For an entree I ordered the sliced fliet mignon burger sans bun.  It is exactly as it sounds; basically a sliced filet mignon.  It was pretty thick so I have no idea how people actually eat the thing on a bun.  Anyway it was excellent as well as good sized.  I would order it again but I keep reading about how the Fleming's prime burger is very good not to mention a 3rd of the cost of the sliced filet burger.  I will probably try that next time.  My wife ordered the portebello mushroom burger and it was awesome.  It was topped with sauteed spinach and goat cheese.  OMG sooo good!  I should order that next time to put on top of a real burger.  It  was actually very good and I could see myself ordering that if I was not in the mood for red meat.  For dessert we all shared the lava cake.  WOW! Sooo good!  You have to order it 20 minutes in advance so you know it is fresh.  It comes with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a bowl of fresh homemade whip cream.  The whole thing was just awesome but that whip cream put it over the edge.  The entire staff that waited on us during the evening were very fast and friendly.  All-in-all it was an excellent evening with great food and service.  I will definitely be back!

The restaurant has the wine cellar appearance with red chairs and mahogany wood everywhere.  There are even pictures of wine bottles hanging on the wall.  It gives off a classy and elegant feel without being too pretentious.    The bread that was given at the beginning was average.  Hard on the outside and soft on the inside.  It was the butter that was taken me by surprise.  There was a chiptole butter and also a sour cream butter.  The chiptole butter was the best.    I chose a Chilean sea bass with sautéed spinach.  It was a flakey and stringy texture as a great bass would have.  The bread crumbs on top added a nice crunchy texture for contrast.  It was a fresh fish which didn't have a fishy taste, but not as good of a taste as expected.  My friend had the filet mignon with crab on top and scallops on the side.  The scallops were the best.  Not too bouncy and cooked just right.  The crab has a mediocre taste.  Something common like it can be made at home.  The filet is tender deep red meat and not that flavorful because of the lack of fat.  And again, it was average.  The dessert was the best part of the meal.  The chocolate lava cake with REAL whipped cream.   The warm rich chocolate center with vanilla ice cream and pistachio on top added to the whole cake.    Overall the food was pretty good, but the value isn't.  For as much as it costs, I would be expecting something better.

Dang..Hate to write this.  Big plans...Make reservation specifically asking for quiet table. Guess what?  They sit us next to a group of 20..... Waiter and staff were very nice..professional. Takes our Drink order..spends the next half hour with the group of 20. Finally I get his attention and beg for another beer. I actually have to ask about getting an appetizer...Dang..  So far the anniversary is going south.... Next we decide to split a $65 Ribeye medium rare..... Comes out raw. Dang.... Could have went to Safeway for this steak. Server tells me be careful with the plate...Hot...and all that.  It was about as hot as a chilled salad plate at Applebees. Dang.. So much for sizzling butter.  Ah..man...Well the coffee was delicious....I will say that. Again, the waiter and staff were top notch. The food was no better than Sizzler..and that is after dropping $200.  Cant risk going back with that kind of damage....

This is an update to a previous review. I was in Phoenix again for a week and came here for dinner one night. The dry aged strip steak was fabulous but the asparagus was overcooked, mushy and just horrible! It was so mushy that the knife couldn't even cut through it. How can you cook a steak just right but screw up something simple as asparagus? It also cost Eleven Dollars, so one would hope to get one's money's worth with a half dozen asparagus stalks. Five star steak dinner and a 0 star side dish on more than one occasion, equals 3 stars.   I'll be back for the steak, but never will I get their overpriced and overcooked asparagus!

We had another fantastic meal!  This was at least our fourth visit here in the last year and it was exceptional.  Took out my in-laws, wife, & son for their Birthdays, which are all pretty close together.  Everyone of us was really happy with our meals.  The adults all had the 8oz. Filet Mignon & Lobster Tail special, which was great.  Everyone's steak was cooked to perfection, we all enjoyed our salads, the Fleming's Potatos, & each of us had a different dessert (delicious & filling).  Our waiter made an excellent suggestion on a Merlot that I wasn't to sure about.  He brought over a sample of it for me to try. I've now found another wine that I will seek to purchase.  This is the fourth wine that we love, that we had at Fleming's first.  Also, my son had a great steak with his kid's meal that he really enjoyed.  Thanks again, Fleming's for a most memorable evening!
