My family of 11 went with a reservation on a Monday night. There was some changes to our party size and the hostesses seemed so stressed about it. I would think that crisis this these would happens from time to time but they acted like the whole world was collapsing and they did not know what t do... get some extra chairs and get on with it! They were beyond annoyed by this time and we were kept waiting in the lobby for them to fix this code red catastrophe (insert eye roll).Ok so on to the actual meal. Our waitress was here and there and forgot more often than forgivable. Also when we were ordering our meal she asked us if we wanted soup or salad with our entrée, in my opinion implying that it was included with the order, but guess what? Not the case. This establishment tries to act like it is some high end steak house, but they only succeed in ACTING like it. My meal was cold and the steaks were a joke. The only good review that I would give would be for their clam chowder. As we were exiting the restaurant the hostesses gave us no more than a look in our direction leaving me feeling like a second class citizen... who spent more than $500 on a below average meal.

Not what you would expect for a $150+ meal for two. For an "upscale" steakhouse the food and service were nothing great. First, we never got the bread our server said would be right out when we arrived. We proceeded to ask for it two additional times before it was finally brought to us when we received our entree. The halibut was ok, but over cooked and the sauce on top was over bearing. The calamari was decent, but I have definitely had better. I also wish they put whatever sauce they had on it on the side so they breaded part stayed crispy. The only saving grace of the meal were the Fleming's potatoes. They were delicious. I doubt I would ever find myself back here, but if I did I would get the potatoes. Lastly, its not necessary to ask every time you refill water/ice tea, just fill it up and if I am not thirsty anymore I won't drink it and thus you won't refill it.   If you are looking for a delicious meal with great service this is not the place for you. My personal favorite in the valley is Mastro's City Hall - you will not leave disappointed.

One of our favorite places.  Very special anniversary treatment, fine prime rib and excellently designed seasonal specials.    The hot lava cake is my wife's favorite and I even enjoy it a little too. Service is exceptional and  I highly recommend it for anniversary's weddings or any occasion you can muster up to celebrate.

My wife and I were on vacation and came to Flemings for my birthday dinner. So for those of you who don't know, everything here is ordered separately unless otherwise. We arrived early and took a seat at the bar, lucky for us Brandon (bartender) was awesome. He went over some drink options, went over the happy hour menu and the dinner menu.  Then it was time to be seated, our waitress Krista was great, just like Brandon. She went over the menu, made some good recommendations and we were not disappointed, she definitely made you feel welcome. I suggest the mac and cheese (to die for), my wife had the prime rib (which according to her was sooooooooo good) and I had the seasonal fish which was cooked to perfection. So after all that goodness and if you have any room left, get the carrot cake and you will love every bite. Our experience was wonderful, from the moment you walk in, we will definitely be coming back.

I stopped in for happy hour this past Friday. I'd previously been for their happy hour, and had a good experience and good food the first time. My first visit I tried the tenderloin carpaccio and the seared ahi tuna. Both were tasty, but I should have only ordered one; I was too full afterwards. I also had a nice glass of merlot that first visit. (I'd give the first visit 3 stars.) This latest visit was not as good; the service wasn't friendly. I sat @ the bar with a buddy, and we both ordered the prime burger. The burger was good, but regardless of how busy the bartenders were, they just weren't friendly (male or female). Shouldn't a place like this offer friendly, quality service? I'm a patient guy, and understand when a place is busy but that doesn't mean quality has to be lacking. I'll go back for the food, but am hoping the service gets better and friendlier.

I was there last weekend with my husband we didn't have reservations they told us there were heaters on the back patio which there was, unfortunately I still froze my butt off (not that it's their fault ) but it was uncomfortable throughout the meal . Also, no one noticed us after 10 minutes to ask if we wanted anything to drink... This is going to sound silly, but an appetizer said pork belly fried appetizer served with cranberry sauce, needless to say I didn't realize that was pure fat on a plate ( most places don't serve pure lard on a plate for a snack)  and I told the waiter that it was not to my liking and he seem to be disgusted by it. This place for the amount of money you pay, I am surprised by the crappy customer service and the food was nothing to brag about. I guess I'll have to make a trip back to Cali for some good food!!!!

The service was outstanding!  Ask for Robert's section if you go, you will be treated very well.  The steaks however were not the best.  We were really craving a good steak so we were excited to try this place.  With so many other options in the DC Ranch/Scottsdale area, we probably will not go back. We ordered medium filets and we both got medium well. My husbands was closer to well done on the outsides.  It's too bad because we like the atmosphere and the service. I was told they are a high end Outback.  I wonder if they rotate chefs too.
Recently returned to Fleming's and had a better experience. I would still like to see better service and lower prices. My prime rib was excellent tho. Kudos to the chef!

My husband and I just left! We had high hopes but the service was so poor! We were there for an hour, sat outside, which we actually liked but the waiter dropped our drinks and appetizers off and never returned! While we did tell him we were thinking of just drinks and appetizers, we would have considered dinner, had he upsold. But we never had a chance considering he never came back to ask if we wanted another wine or beer...very unwelcoming and we felt like we were a nuisance after a table of 6 were sat just beside us. My husband had to go to the hostess station to ask for a check. Considering the average prices for dinner at Flemings, I would expect better service. We have had beyond better service at local places as well as high priced. Texas Star in San Diego comes to my mind.

So- I always come here for happy hour. I actually haven't had regular dinner at this location- ever.  The happy hour menu is pretty cool- it's limited, but the stuff is tasty.  I have, however, had a problem with slow service here.  Frustratingly slow actually- which isn't expected for this type of restaurant.

This place while incredibly expensive is delicious. There filet is great and the ribeye is even better. They cooked them to a perfect medium rare as well. The creamed spinach side is probably as good as the steaks themselves. The lobster one person had there was not that great which is my only complaint. The service though is unmatched, they are incredible.

Fianlly a happy hour that made me happy.  If you want some great food and drinks on a current economy budget the daily 5-7 happy hr may be a good choice for you.  $5 specialty drinks including a pomitini poured at the table. This drink was quite good and yes girly.  $5 appetizers including a great seared Ahi with a Jicama carrot salad. The Ahi has well spiced and of decent quality.  There are other $5 options as well.  $6 burger that looked huge and induced 2 onion rings and a challa roll for a bun.   There also is a $12 ahi burger that is more of a croquet style with 2 onion rings or a portobello burger too.  This happy hr is available at the bar era, or in the more relaxed patio. There are heaters on the patio for the cooler nights.  With thees prices we kept eating, and eating and yes eating. We left stuffed on great food.  I recommended a side of the saluted mushrooms of the menu as they really enhance any meal.

Came here on my birthday and was not impressed. The atmosphere was nice but my husband and I were not happy with the food at all. The bread they gave pre-meal was just ok but didn't seem very fresh. There were two types of butter that came along with the bread and both were actually pretty good. I ordered the lobster bisque to start and honestly, the flavor was a bit odd. I personally think the lobster bisque at Red Lobster is better not to mention cheaper. For dinner, I ordered the seared scallops that came on top of puff pastry and a measly portion of vegetables. The scallops were gritty and seemed like they had not been cleaned properly as I could taste granules of sand. My husband ordered the ribeye since Flemings is supposed to be known for their steak. He said that the steak was not seasoned at all. For sides, we ordered the Flemings potatoes which were really good and the baked potato which was fine, but honestly, how hard is it to mess up baked potato? When the check was presented they also gave me a box of chocolate truffles since it was my birthday. I wont lie, these were amazing!!! Unfortunately, the truffles, Flemings potatoes, and butter will not make me come back. I am all about giving places several tries before deciding to go back but not a place with a huge price tag such as Flemings. When I spend $100 on a dinner for two, I expect everything to be sensational and Flemings was very far from it.  PS: The husband said it was the worst steak ever and you would be better to light your money on fire rather then spending it here. :)

I had received gift cards from my company as a gift on valentine's day ,unfortunately  my company keeps me so busy we just never had time to go ,so we had some free time and decided to check out the restaurant,  it was our first time there , service was great, we had the chefs choice filet mignon and lobster the wife had crab when food arrived the steak was awesome ,one of the best steaks I ever had , the lobster for me was super small and my wife felt the same about the crab ,but it was good I just felt portion size was small

My husband and I go here for special occasions like birthdays or anniversary dinners and it is always a great experience. We recently went for our friends birthday and had another great experience! I love the complimentary valet parking, the staff is great, and the food is always so delicious. This last time we had the chocolate lava cake for the first time and that is what has me writing this review! It was simply amazing THE BEST lava cake I have ever had in my life!

We had the chance to give this place another chance for dinner tonight. Food was really good. Steak was cooked to perfection. Our server was amazing. Appetizer was really good and the lava cake was just fabulous.  Just updating my previews review we were glad we gave this place a second chance.  Thank you Nick.

Excellent bday dinner started with signed bday card from the staff for my bday date - nice touch! Our waitress was wonderful - not too intrusive, but very helpful and even helped put on my girls bday necklace - nice! Dinner started with surprise seared scallop on cheese sauce which was delicious. Wedge salads with blue cheese, nuts, and crisp piece of bacon was fantastic. Then our entree of filet, lobster, asparagus, and Flemings potatoes. Steak cooked perfect - everything was amazing. Then bday desert with chocolate tart filled with gooey chocolate and 2 ice cream scoops, with fresh raspberry. Really, the entire meal and bday experience was perfect - both my bday date and myself were completely impressed. Thank you Flemings for a wonderful night.
My steak is cooked exactly how I want it every time. The service surpasses my own expectations. Yes this is not the greatest deal on a steak dinner but its worth it!

Thought we'd try a different restaurant tonight so we decided on Fleming's in Chandler.  Enjoyed a nice dinner with my wife and friends. Fleming's is a great place for steaks.  I love a good NY Strip steak and the one I had tonight was well seasoned, flavorful, and cooked just as ordered, medium rare. My wife kept saying that her lobster tails were delicious. I should add that the French onion soup was very tasty, better than most. Oh, I don't want to forget to mention the delicious brussel sprouts. Seasoned with bacon... what's not to love? Service was adequate, but I thought our server could have been a little more attentive.  All in all, a great steakhouse.

Had an extremely delightful experience here while visiting Arizona in October. The service was great - waiter was not pushy, but there whenever needed. The food (especially my steak) was excellent, as was the wine. Can't wait to bring my husband here when we visit again.

Fun and elegant happy hour! Lite bites and also a glorious wine list! Service was quick and assistive. Patio was lit with heaters for warmth on a chilly night. I had the carpaccio and baked brie which were fab! Both were tasty and would definitely order again. Wine was served in proper glasses and so many to choose from. It is a pricey place but a superb place for an elegant happy hour

Ok here it goes . 1-5 scale for Fleming's. Steak 5, 12 oz Filet mignon was cooked to order and tasty  Potatoes:4 very tasty, but expensive Cajun shrimp: 5  (Big shrimp cooked nicely) Service:5 friendly yet efficient   Conclusion: Steak alone will fill you here, sides are delicious but extravagantly priced.  Service is A+. Great if you are rich or for special occasions.

I really can't find any reason to not give Fleming's 5 stars.  Is it absolutely the best meal I have ever had, no, but pretty darn good.  We have been going to Fleming's for years and will continue to do so.  Yes, it is expensive for a typical night out so it's not a go-to that often for us but we still really enjoy the little splurge every now and again.  Fleming's is a great date night or special occasion place with friends.  I typically get the petite filet with the 3oz add-on shelled lobster tail.  The filet is always cooked to perfection and extremely tasty.  The lobster looks small when it is served but is always the right amount for me.  We almost always get a few sides and last night was no different.  We had our standard creamed spinach (my fav), Fleming's potatoes and creamed corn (I wasn't a huge fan of the creamed corn as it was a little spicy and that's not my thing).  The service is always excellent.  Almost forgot to mention that I love the Farmer's Daughter Martini...Delicious!  But beware, they go down quickly!  It's always a nice night out at Fleming's.  Just writing this review is making me hungry!!

What a pleasant and attractive place with great food.  My wife and I have been here 4 or 5 times in the past couple of years and have always received great food and courteous service.  I can vouch for the quality and taste of their meat, fish and sides.  You get wonderful dishes, large portions, cooked perfectly, according to your instructions.  Not only do they make their meat and fish dishes to excel, but you can't improve on .the flavor or consistency of any of their side dishes, making the veggies sing and dance in your mouth and their desserts take a curtain call!  Add reasonable prices to it all and you will have a wonderful and memorable repast at Fleming's.  You can't miss and they won't either.

This is sort of a tough review.  Flemings puts themselves out as high-end, and they charge high-end prices.  So one expects more from them than, for example, a Black Angus.  Normally I wouldn't go to a high-end steak house.  Frankly between my wife and I, we can do as well or better at home.  She does a couple of different seasonings depending on her mood, and I am pretty good at grilling them.  Anyway...we were invited to a seminar and the deal was they would feed us here.  Flemings does have some menu options you won't see at Black Angus, which is fine.  On this occasion I had the filet medallions (I think that's what they called them) with mashed potatoes and green beans.  Really nothing that fancy, but done properly this would be really good.  First point...I ordered medium well.  We agreed (the waiter and I) that this meant there would be a little pink, but not much.  Just a bit.  So when it come out it's medium rare.  VERY pink.  Not even medium.  Gotta mark them down for that.  Lots of places do that, and it's annoying.  I've given up asking anyone to cook it more because it always comes back either dry or burned.  Not Flemings specifically, but any steak place.  It's like they're annoyed..."you want it done more, I'll show you 'done more', you cretin!!".  Instead I just live with it.  Flavor-wise the filet was good.  Basic seasoning, nothing fancy.  But "nothing fancy" works in this case.  Nice flavor.  The potatoes were a bit cheesy, not much garlic.  They were fine.    Nothing special.  I think a bit more garlic was in order as I couldn't really detect any. The green beans I thought were a little under-cooked but I know a lot of people like that crisp snap.  The seasoning of the beans was good.  More than just a little salt, they really jazzed them up.  I liked them.  So the verdict?  Well, given how they bill themselves and what you pay I simply expect more.  I expect exciting flavors (even with potatoes), and I expect them to know what "medium-well" means and how to achieve it.  The meal was fine.  Even good.  But was it truly "high-end"?  I don't think so.  I've had high-end a few times, and this wasn't it.  So they're "OK", but I can't go so far as to say I'm a fan.  Three stars.

My boyfriend and I decided to treat ourselves to a great night to celebrate and have a great night.   We were disappointed and the experience ruined what was supposed to be a great Saturday night.  We had reservations and were seated immediately in a great booth. Our waiter was friendly and we got off to a great start. Two cocktails, French onion soup and a shrimp cocktail to start. So far so good. Then we ordered a wedge salad, a steak each, two sides and two glasses of wine. I would not recommend using the electronic device to pick out wines as it was super confusing and looking at the wines on the printed menu was definitely easier. He ordered his steak medium and I ordered mine medium rare. When they arrived, the tip of his was medium but the rest was rare at best. Mine was underdone as well although not as much. There was literally a pool of blood on his plate by the time we finally got the waiter back to our table after flagging another waiter to get him. We were embarrassed (because how are you supposed to have to do that at a place like this) but sent it back. A manager stopped by and said he understood it was under cooked and we explained the situation. He listened but it felt a little patronizing. What came back looked like a hockey puck. At that point, we just told them they could take it away. We were so embarrassed that we just asked for the check and wanted to leave. Our night was ruined. And we somehow felt like it was our fault. They removed that steak from our check and a round of cocktails but our check was still $200. I received an email survey that I completed after the experience and still have heard nothing. The steaks were the only problem with our meal but we were at a STEAK HOUSE. How is that what they screw up?!??!?!?! And why did we feel like it was our fault the meal wasn't as we ordered it? We've had MUCH better meals at The Keg and plan to keep it that way. A HUGE disappointment and we won't be back.

Tried this place on business trip. Ordered salad and ribeye steak. The steak was good but not great same for the salad. Ruth's Chris is way better than this place. They have the best steak and I will recommend it instead of this place.

This is a strange review to write, because I'm a fan of Fleming's. I expect to write a 5 star review every time... but today, this is a 3 Star review that was bumped to 4 for good reason. I came in with a party of 8 coworkers, celebrating the end of the year. Our party included a mixture of people, some who eat at higher end restaurants on occasion, and some who were experiencing $50 steaks for the first time. Those of us with a little more experience, hyped up Fleming's and set expectations high. After all, it doesn't get a whole heck of a lot better. Right? We took advantage and ordered a lot of food. For starters we had the crab cakes, the calamari and the cold seafood tower. The calamari was fantastic! Great flavor, and this coming from someone who normally doesn't like calamari. Crab cake was good, though not amazing, and everything in the seafood tower was solid.  We had a couple of bottles of  a great Cab, Stag's Leap Artemis- which was wonderful ($135 a bottle). A few salads were ordered, all looked good and plates were cleaned. We shared a number of sides; Fleming's potatoes, mashed potatoes, asparagus, mushrooms, Brussel sprouts, and the Mac-n-cheese. All the sides were good, no complaints at all. Fleming's potatoes and the Brussels sprouts (believe it or not) seemed to get the best reviews. The disappointment tonight, shockingly, was the steaks. 7 of 8 ordered steaks. 5 of the 7 were cooked at the wrong temperature, 4 under cooked and one over cooked.  I'm not a complainer and I'm pretty good at eating a steak anywhere around medium, but my steak was medium-rare and closer to rare than medium-rare. As I cut around the edges of my $60 steak, I noticed others doing the same. After taking a pole, I learned that nearly everyone had an issue with their temperature. Problem was, by the time a waiter came by to see how everything was, the meal was half over. He asked how everything was, and I showed him my steak. I asked, "what temperature is this?", he said "mid-rare", that's right! But I ordered medium, and so did he, and so did she, and him over there...all the medium temps were cooked mid/rare to rare and one was cooked closer to med/well. Not one was cooked perfectly. Very surprised. I've never had temperatures so far off, for so many, in a single meal at any restaurant.  The issue of course is sending your steak back when the meal is half over. By the time you get it returned, everyone is finished and you're eating alone! No thanks, I'm not going to send it back- but I'm not happy. I expect wrong temperatures from Outback or Texas Roadhouse, but not Fleming's. And certainly not 5 of 7 steaks. If that was the end, I'd call this a 3 Star review. However....  The manager came by and said he heard there was a problem with some of the temperatures, I showed him what was left of my steak, explained that 5 of the 7 were wrong and why it was too late in the meal to send them back. He apologized, and without batting and eye, said they expect better and so should we...and took all 5 steaks off our bill. That's about $300, just like that.   I wasn't asking for free food and truth be told, my undercooked steak was still really tasty, just not the way I ordered it. The manager could have stopped at offering to cook our steaks more, or bringing a new one, but understood that it was too late. He went above and beyond my expectations by removing them from our bill. And that's why I had to add a star.   Will I be back? Yes I will. I've had a number of 5 star experiences at Fleming's...and now that I know there's basically a money back guarantee, I've got nothing to lose! A+ on the customer service.

Brandon is AWESOME!! He is a great bartender who knows how to balance the servers, the bar guest, and be inviting all at the same time. Best of all:he is truthful!!! Who doesn't hate those bartenders/servers that sell you on terrible products just because they are more expensive?   Now let's talk about the food. Always cooked to order and promptly served. You never get the feeling that YOU, the guest, are bothering the staff. Maybe that is just at the bar, but hopefully it extends to the whole restaurant!!! They have a fantastic happy hour from 5-7, then have ANOTHER one from 8-10!!!! The second is a little more expensive but sooo worth it!!! I will continue to dine and suggest other do the same.

This is a high-end steakhouse and you pay for it. I never spend my own money here... too expensive - but I never pass up a chance to eat here on someone else's dime!  All the food is excellent... the one time my steak was bad they took it back no questions asked, gave me another and comp'd the entree.  The seafood tower, if you can afford it, is fantastic. The wine selection, as you'd expect, is very good.  Not much else to say as since if you know what a high-end steakhouse is supposed to be, this is it.

Flemings has predictably great service, good atmosphere, good food and an expensive bill. Great for a special ocasion. The steaks are not quite on par with some of the other top tier steakhouses in Phoenix. But, it's still one of my favorites.

Ate Dinner here when I was visiting a friend in Arizona. The food was superb. The locatiion was nice and the ambiance was beautiful. Had a pork chop and crab cakes and that food was delcious. Also tried the Fleming Potatoes and was so stuffed I couldn't finish it but they were delicious as well. I highly recommend this place. Prices are expensive though so don't forget your wallet. LOL

It's Flemming's, need I say more. Brought some customers here for a post meeting dinner and Brian, our waiter, was fabulous.  Kept all orders perfectly matched and was always attentive. Multiple New York Strips were cooked to perfection. I ordered mine smothered in blue cheese. Wow! So perfectly medium rare and the cheese and juices still make my mouth water.  In my opinion, the best chain chop house in the country.

Oh how I love restaurant week!  1st stop was Fleming's -- I totally dig the Fleming salad, then again I'm a big fan of cranberries in general.  Their filet I thought was nicely done, when I want medium I want it medium!  As for dessert -- nothing to rave about since it kind of fell flat for me.  Not a huge fan of chocolate over chocolate with some chocolate.... know what I mean?  Service was real good they were attentive and quick.  Ambience was nothing too surprising except I wish I had wore my blazer with a cigar sticking out of my mouth while walking around with a Wallstreet Journal clip under my arm.  Hand me my walking stick Remington!  Overall, it was a good experience and the food was good.  I though I can't recommend becoming a regular especially with today's food price. - Enjoy!

My fiancé took me here for a mother's day present, and it was great! Service was awesome, and the manager Nick came over to check on us. After dinner we sat at the bar for a bit, the bartenders there are awesome!  Side note: get the Fleming's potatoes. Sometimes I dream about their deliciousness.
My husband and I came here for our anniversary. We both got filets and they were incredible, perfect temperature and VERY flavorful. The service was phenomenal as well. A true 5-star restaurant.

We visited Flemings for the steak and lobster special. Our meals were cooked perfectly and the portions were just right. Our server, Byron M. was excellent. He made sure our visit was great. He was very attentive.

We had a party of four reservation at 7:15 and we got in pretty much exactly at that time. Service was fast and friendly. The bread and butter was amazing and the steak was even better.. I got the NY strip for 41 bucks and it was huge and worth every juicey penny.

We have dined at this Flemings location numerous times before and had wonderful experiences, however, this time things fell very flat.  Things started off fine with water and a wine list that was provided via Ipad.  My fiance's mother asked the waitress for wine recommendations and she wasn't able to help ( it seemed like she wasn't too familiar with the selection).  Ordering food was fairly quick and easy.  Once we received our steaks, the waitress informed us about the lava cake that takes 20 minutes to cook, and told us she would check back in shortly to see if we were interested.  We didn't see her again for at least 30 minutes.   I know, I know.  When people usually say 30 minutes they are grossly overestimating out of frustration; however, we actually did wait that long.  So long in fact, it began to get awkward at the table.  All the food was consumed and our wine glasses were empty, yet our waitress was nowhere in sight.  When she did finally show, it was too late to order the lava cake.  We instead ordered two plates of creme brulee and two desserts to go, along with a cup of coffee.  The coffee was cold, and it took 10 minutes to get a new hot cup.  Once dessert was finished we again were left waiting around for our waitress; waiting to clear dishes, waiting to receive the check, and again, waiting to pay the check.  In all it took us two hours to have a simple meal, and that was not by choice.    The food was great, per usual, but the service was just downright bad.

Service was great!   Nick was a fantastic waiter!   The food.....meh....The Keg is definitely better. We gave this place a shot after hearing great things about it.   I can't put my finger on it, there was just nothing special about it, especially for its higher price range. The Filet was just ok, and a little chewy. The truffle mashed potatoes were good.   My wife got the french toast brunch special, and it was not good at all. She did not eat but one bite. She said it reminded her of bread pudding.   Needless to say, we will keep going to The Keg for our steak house dinners.

The steak was good, but not particularly impressive at $40 per plate. I got the Surf and Turf special with scallops, and two 5oz filet. The filets were good, cooked perfectly, and great cuts of meat. Just not wowed. The real disappointment was in the scallops that came with the dish. For the class of the place, one expects a certain level, and those scallops didn't even come close.

Had a LobsterFeast here.... and was not.. NOT, disappointed.  We order the "LOBSTER TOWER" as our appy... soooo GOOOD!  The lobster-cobb salad was a trough of yumminess!!!... I didn't even hit the bottom of the salad bowl... it was soooooo gooooood....  Dessert was devilishly delicious...  Gettin serviced by Anthony was seamless and nice....   Would I go again?  HECK YES!!

Here again. Steak BURNED. Sent it back. Came back really burned. We were with a party of 16. So I just sent it back and told him I didn't want a steak anymore. No manager came and apologized.   Come one Flemings.

Went here for New Year's eve, Gary was our fabulous server -very attentive and shared lots of great information about the food. Our main course of fillet mignon and truffle mash potatoes were on point, perfect! Also had their signature chocolate lava cake, a little fancy for my blood but my husband ate every last bite. they also have a great happy hour, worth the money to splurge on a great meal. Also, their bread and multiple butters to dip in were delicious!

Fleming's has never been my favorite place to eat dinner, but I do love to go for their Five Six Seven menu in the lounge or on the patio. Though the prices have gone up over the years, it is still a decent deal for what it is. We started with the Blueberry Lemon Drop Martinis which were refreshing and tart with just a little sweetness. The calamari was good, but too much sauce made it soggier than preferred. We also tried the crab cakes, which to my surprise were some of the best I've had! The prime burger is always good, though the brioche bun and pepper bacon are what really shine through, and always get their onion rings (way better than their fries). Lastly my sister got the flatbread on the 567 menu. I didn't try it, but she said it was delicious. Only downfall besides the increased prices would be that the lighting is so dim in the bar are you can barely see the people sitting in front of you. Will be back for sure, but probably not anytime soon.

Dinner at Fleming's was fantastic! The service was professional and attentive. Food was delish; my barbecued salmon fillet flaked perfectly, and the bed of sautéed mushrooms underneath were the perfect complement. Lighting is low and intimate, so it's great for personalized occasions.

Although the steak was terrific, the service was slow and the food was cold when it did come.  When making my reservations, I had asked for the warmest spot in the house but we were seated in a cold and drafty area.  Very disappointing because we brought my mother for a very special occasion and we were all sorry we had come

My boyfriend has taken me to this place twice and I absolutely love it.  The service is always top notch.  We have had the same waiter both times and it was nice he remembered us.  The appetizers and the main dish are always on point.  I always get the filet mignon and I love it.  We love going here and will continue to go.

I don't normally like to write negative reviews, and I certainly did not expect to write one about this steak chain based on its reputation, but our first experience here will be our last.  We chose to eat at Fleming's because we wanted a nice dinner before a show we were seeing at the AMC Cinema across the highway.  Our reservation was early, 5PM, just at opening.  Perhaps this was the mistake we made, or perhaps our experience was typical.  Entering the restaurant I was instantly blinded by how dark it was.  It was as if they had forgotten to turn on the lights.  Being led to our small, cramped, too narrow booth, I bumped into other booth edges and tripped over chairs because I could not see them.  After squeezing into the seat I was handed the wine list which I also could not read.  It took a good 10 minutes for my eyes to adjust to the cave-like lighting.  Not impressed.  Also not impressive was the waiter, who maybe was having a bad day or maybe he had just arrived and was not yet in "waiter mode" or maybe he was just a jerk, but he was not attentive nor seemingly interested in serving us.  He did not have a suggestion for wine even after I informed him I was ordering a bottle, which is not in character for a "Wine" restaurant.  If he worked for me he'd have been out on his ear.  The wine list was good, although short on our favorite varietals.  We found the one red Zinfandel on the list to try.  And then we waited.  A bus boy brought us water, but no bread.  Other tables seemed to have bread.  We waited some more.  And some more.  Does it take 30 minutes to get a bottle of wine?  I started checking my watch, knowing we only had 2 hours until the show.  Eventually the waiter returned with the wine.  I tried to joke with him that maybe the bottle was just a hard one to find and he grunted something unintelligible, showed me the label for 5 seconds and popped the cork, then asked if we were ready to order.  We ordered salads and steaks and he said "thanks" and left.  OK, I will pour my own glass.  The salads were the highlight of the meal.  My wife had a wedge and I had their special salad, and we both enjoyed them.  This was the only part of the meal we enjoyed.  When the steaks arrived we had to ask for bread to accompany the meat, which eventually arrived.  The steaks looked to be done to our Med-Rare order but both my wife's filet and my aged NY Strip were raw at one end.  It was almost as if they had been half-off the grill.  We could not eat them, and had no time to send them back.  We ate what we could and had the rest boxed to nuke at home.  My wife ordered a side of mushrooms and I the asparagus, and while the asparagus was done it was flavorless and my wife's mushrooms so full of garlic that was all they tasted of.  We finished our wine, paid the nearly $300 check and left.  We will not be back.  Also, we cannot assert that there were hormones in the beef, but my wife is sensitive to this and after eating here she was sick for some time.  Ugh.  We cannot assert that the beef was tainted... however...

The food was amazing! Service was good but considering my fiancé and I apparently don't look the part we felt constantly hounded, "checked up on" and rushed out from our dinner. It felt a little awkward and unfortunate. I have to say I'm pretty disappointed in the reaction of a young tattooed couple trying to enjoy a nice evening together and wished we were not to feel so judged as if we were going to "dine and ditch" little alone my wine ended up needing to get replaced from a fly getting into it.
Took my wife for her birthday and we loved every minute of this place! Great food, great service!

I MUST write an update from my last review.  After my recent "poor" review on Yelp, I received an email and phone call, from John Jeffrey, Operations Manager.  John went over the issues I mentioned and invited me back to their location.  I must admit, I was very hesitant. I don't write reviews to receive anything for free, I only write reviews only to warn future customers.  I told John I was unsure if I would be back, but he encouraged me to come back in and allow them another opportunity.  My husband and I decided to go tonight and it was FABULOUS!  Every expectation I had was met this this time!  I would highly recommend Flemings, in Chandler, to anyone I know.   Thank you again John, for taking the time to reach out to me, and to invite us back.  We will be back to your location in the future!!!!
Great food, excellent staff and classy yet relaxed ambiance. Location was also perfect for a nearby date night with the hubby.

I had never been here before and was SUPER excited to eat here for Thanksgiving dinner I heard great things about the restaurant, so needless to say I was very disappointed in the food. I got the steak and lobster and it wasn't good at all no flavor it was just so blah nothing special about it and for the price you pay the food should be out of this world and it's just not and not worth going and spending all that money just to be let down I hate to say this but I would've rather gone to the Outback and had their steak and lobster at least I know I would've enjoyed my dinner. I won't be back nor will I refer people to the restaurant don't waste your money people.

Very interesting.  We've been to this Fleming's on several occasions, and tonight seemed to be a continuation of the progression downhill for this restaurant, in my opinion.  We decided to make this a family of four dinner, bringing our 10 and 12 year olds.  Obviously, we tried to stick with steak at this steak house.  We came at opening, about 5pm, arriving at 4:50.  They did have us wait until they were ready at 5pm, and that's okay.  The opening, though, plays a big part later in this review.  We stuck with water, as you can run up a really high bill very quickly.  Our orders were taken late (about 15 minute wait)  because we had not ordered drinks, and the waiters were busy brining out wine, etc, to the other tables.  The bread was fresh, but the butter was not.  It was dried out, like it had been frozen, and we were served the freezer burnt butter.  I asked for the Crab Cake appetizer to be brought out at the same time as everyone else's plate.  This was screwed up, and was brought out early.  So everyone else had to watch me eat.  I was having this as a "small plate" dish.  The boys had the specials, which were a petite filet mignon along with 3 scallops.  We asked for medium--they were undercooked, more along the lines of rare to medium-rare.  The scallops were well cooked, but a little bland.  The 10 year old did not like them, and he usually really enjoys seafood.  I added on the Chipotle Cheddar Macaroni and Cheese for the kids, which they liked, along with Half and Half, which is shoestring fries with Onion Rings, both tasted okay.  My wife had the Double Thick Pork Rib Chop.  The sauce was very tasty, BUT the pork was underdone, and was visibly raw in the middle.  This was unacceptable.  We had to send the plate back, which was put under the broiler, and then brought back to us.  I have to say this is the second time in a row that my wife's meat was raw at this Fleming's.  I would've chalked it up to oven not being hot enough for the first dishes, but this seems to be a recurrent problem.    I had a small plate, the Sliced Filet Mignon, which is served on Risotto.  The meat was very well done, but the risotto was completely dried out and tasteless. I was very disappointed.  As it took about another 10-15 minutes between when our plates were taken away and our waiter came with the dessert menu, we had decided to skip dessert and coffee and make our way to Starbucks, about two buildings away.  I'm willing to forgive the delays due to them just opening up.  Plus, it was Veteran's Day.  However, the food being underprepared for the second time in a row is unforgivable, especially for as expensive a restaurant as Fleming's is.  This is really starting to feel like a "chain" restaurant as it really is rather than an exclusive steak restaurant, which they strive to be.  Overall, I think we're done with Fleming's.

After my last review Fleming's manager, Miguel, gave me a phone call expressing his apologies for our less than stellar experience and invited me to come back.  I was a bit shocked by the phone call but also very grateful.  Fleming's obviously takes their customer satisfaction very seriously and it made mew feel good knowing that time was taken to care about how I was feeling.   Words cannot express how amazing our revisit was.  Linda's service was impeccable and I would highly recommend asking for her section next time you go.   I ordered the Mozzarella and Tomato salad, what a vision of loveliness it was (see pics) and it tasted just heavenly, the mozzarella melted in my mouth and the tomato's were so sweet and juicy along with that spicy basil I would have been happy just stopping there.   For my entree I decided to try the Barbecue Scottish salmon Fillet.........WOW!!  Absolutely incredible! This is bar far the best item I've ordered here and is now my new favorite. (see pics) It's sweet and slightly crisp BBQ glaze had me yearning for more.   Now I haven't ordered mashed potatoes from Flemings in years since they took their horseradish mashed potatoes off the menu, but let me tell you after trying their Parmesan peppercorn mashed potatoes I soon forgot my long lost favorite, these ones were to die for!!!  Perfectly creamy, thick , buttery and seasoned to perfection I will be ordering these from now on most definitely!   My husband's usual order of chipotle mac and cheese and a medium rare fillet was no exception to the excellence, he reveled in every bite!   What a total surprise it was when Linda brought him a Creme' Brulee with a candle to re-celebrate his Birthday!  That my dear friends is attention to detail and absolutely made us feel very special and quite frankly made our night!   Our entire evening was flawless from first bite to last.  I can't Thank Miguel and Linda enough for taking such good care of us and we will without a doubt continue dining with you.  You won back my heart and I must say you deserve 5++++++ stars!!

We went here to celebrate my husband's promotion. Our steaks were delicious and cooked to our preferred perfection.  I added the lobster with caviar and it was unbelievably tender and melted in my mouth.  We had the lava cake for dessert and nearly died and went to heaven it was so delicious! Pricing is high but we'll worth it!

I thought I had previously offered a review of Flemings, but I guess I didn't.  So here goes....  Long story short - GREAT STEAKHOUSE in Chandler, AZ!  I received a gift card at Christmas while visiting my partner's family in Phoenix.  We decided to check out the restaurant considering we don't have a Flemings in Portland, OR.  The place is part of the Open Table reservation system which worked perfectly.  I made a reservation via Open Table and collected 1000 points for doing so.  Even better!  We arrived a few minutes early and were greeted by a kind hostess who immediately attended to our reservation.  The place was a bit swanky, but not too intimidating.  The lighting in the restaurant was perfect.  It had a lively ambiance and the patrons were middle-age to older and a bit more upscale than say, Outback Steakhouse.  We were seated and assigned a very knowledgeable waiter who introduced himself as well as the menus and wine selections.  We were offered a choice of either white or black linens which took me by surprise.  Of course I chose black from the standard white as I knew that would hide any unseemly messes.  The food arrived well-presented and almost reverently.  Our plates looked AMAZING!  I ordered a filet mignon which was grilled to perfection.  The medallion melted in my mouth!  The garlic mashed was equally delicious and the asparagus was cooked al dente.  We savored each bite and anxiously looked forward to dessert.  We ordered creme brûlée and raspberry chocolate lava cake.  One word:  HEAVENLY!  The dessert was a perfect ending to an already amazing meal.  Needless to say, we left Flemings more than satisfied.  The service, food, atmosphere and cost led to a very harmonious experience for all of us.  We will definitely put Flemings on the agenda of places to dine when we're back in Arizona in a few weeks.  Heck, we'll visit on EVERY visit to AZ!   Thank you Flemings for the outstanding hospitality and excellent service experience!

We went to celebrate our anniversary and were not disappointed. Our waiter was great. We shared the spinach salad and chipotle mac & cheese. Both were very good. My husband LOVED his ribeye. I had the filet topped with a crab cake and béarnaise sauce. It was perfection. So good. Neither of us were able to finish our meals because we wanted to leave space for desert. We shared the crime brûlée. It was amazing. We topped it with the Chantilly cream, which you can just eat alone with a spoon. It was the perfect cap to the night. Because of the occasion, they also sent us home with truffles and a $25 gift card for our next visit. Great evening.

We have eaten at some of the best steak places in both the US and Canada and were pleasantly surprised at Flemings. For starters the Seafood Tower is a meal and amazing, my wife had the Wedge Salad with a slab of bacon, which I had to tryI had the Clam Chowder, outstanding ! We split a 12 ounce filet with the coffee rub, perfectly cooked and delicious. The Fleming potatoes were good, expected more of a kick with jalapeños but still good. Finished the meal with coffee and a Sambuca on the rocks! We will be back!

This was an awesome meal for me. I ordered the main filet and it was fantastic. Cooked perfectly to order and tasted amazing. The lack of the fifth star was for price and one minor shortcoming in service.   Price: dinner for two with gratuity came out to $200! That is pretty high even considering the quality.   Service: between our order and the arrival of our dinner there was some down time. This would have been a great opportunity to offer us a second round of bread. I watched other tables have the same experience. I think this must be a policy. Might be a policy to review.

Wanted a top notch meal and that's what we got.  The pork belly appetizer was cooked perfectly and also had a polenta/cherry sauce that worked well.  Wedge salad was a pleasure - big slices of blue cheese on fresh bacon.  Wonderful.  All entrees were prepared perfectly - dry aged ribeye, filet, salmon - excellent.  Mac and cheese and au gratin potatoes were just as decadent as we'd expect.  The onions were a bit grainy but not bad.  For desert we got a molten lava cake - oozy as expected plus a perfectly crisp vanilla cookie and ice cream.  Wow.  A grass hopper for a night cap and I'm already planning my next trip.  Service was very good.

First time here, for 11 year wedding anniversary.  Caesar salad was good. Had to wait too long for our entree. I had a ribeye cooked med. rare and was cooked perfect. My wife had a filet mignon cooked medium but it came out med. well. She did not want to wait for a new one so she ate it. We told our waiter about it and he comped our dessert. Had the molten lava cake for dessert, it was awesome.
Delish!  Do I need to say more?  For a nice mean try Flemings.  Great happy hour too.

Overall visit was great with no real complaints. I ordered lobster tail which was served with warm butter in a dish above a candle to keep it warm. Which I loved because it made the lobster taste even more delicious. The lava cake is definitely worth it. The peach mule was not peachy at all in fact it was very limey and tasted more like a margarita. Perhaps it was made wrong but I didn't taste the peach whatsoever and for a 18 dollar cocktail I would hope for something that tastes like the description. Also, ambiance was fine but you are very close to everyone else as far as seating and it is VERY dark so seeing your food is actually really difficult. Other than that the food is great and I'll definitely come back. Good for date nights and celebratory dinners for sure but not the best place for young children. You will also spend a lot here so made sure you plan on it. For the 2 of us it was over 200 with 1 cocktail, 2 entrees, 1 side, and 2 desserts.

It was my Birthday and my wife, her mom, a dear friend and I headed to Fleming's Steakhouse in Chandler, AZ. We heard only great things about this place and wanted to experience their 'unforgettable' steak dishes. That, we did, unfortunately.   The restaurant was lovely dim-lit, adequate atmosphere for an expensive steak place. We were seated immediately and tended to by the waiting staff. The small roll of bread and two kinds of butter were good but insufficient for four hungry souls and we polished it up right away. No one offered to bring more. Our waiter told us about the daily specials, after which we ordered food and wine. After a short wait, four large dinner plates arrived. I was the lucky one, my steak (a large  rib eye steak, ordered medium-rare which tasted very good despite two large blobs of fat) was sitting pretty in the middle of the large dinner plate. Nothing else on my plate, just the steak. I looked around at my wife's plate and couldn't believe, her fillet mignon was laying there, in the middle of the large dinner plate without anything garnishing it, be that a glaze, a leaf, a slice of whatever! At the prices asked by this restaurant, it felt like an insult to each of us to have such a poor presentation of a steak!! We asked our waiter for a side dish, mashed potatoes with Parmesan, and when they arrived, we couldn't believe it! There were no more than two scraggly potatoes turned into mashed potatoes, or about a tablespoon of mashed potatoes per person. Mind you, they tasted good, but at over $9.00 per side dish? In short, we left hungry and wondering why we spent over $200 for the entire meal.  Next time, we'll go to a well tried place for steaks and more. Durant's, downtown Phoenix and worth the drive.

OMG OMG OMG, the happy hour hamburger is so delicious (I think it's the bacon that does it).   I've only been here twice, and both times for happy hour. They have an excellent happy hour for the quality of food they serve. I've tried, obviously the burger and also the crab cakes, both which were yummy. The drink specials are great too, they make a great margarita and have an ample wine list. I'll be back!

Consistently incredible service and flawless steaks award Fleming's Steakhouse five big ones. I've been to steakhouses all over the country and this place holds it's own with the best of them while not being overbearingly expensive. It's not cheap by any means, and it's got a dash more of the old school cool flare than the modern feel to it, but I don't consider that a particular fault. Few places at this point in time get me as fired up as knowing I'm going to Fleming's for a bone-in rib-eye... that thing is a masterpiece.

Staff was very accommodating, service was good. Drinks are overpriced.   I ordered the filet with Gorgonzola, it was cooked properly, tender, and appropriate size. We ordered the Diablo Shrimp as an accompaniment, they were too small and overpriced. The flavor was delicious however.   Scalloped potatoes were not good and would never order again.   I would recommend Del Frisco's or Maeastros any day before Flemings.

Flemings Flemings Flemings ...   Well, upon arrival, I was shocked at how loud it was on the dining room floor. There are other seating areas, but the main dining is in one particular area. I will say apart from the noise, I enjoyed the lighting and the atmosphere in general; lots of people smiling and enjoying food.   I ordered the Chilean sea bass & ended up sending it back. Here's why: the 'broth' that it comes in is a bit much for me. My fish was swimming in a broth that made the crunchy bits of potato soggy & took away from the overall enjoyment of the fish. The fish itself was cooked perfectly, but it lacked flavor. The chile pesto that was used to dress the plate was FABULOUS ! I'm wondering why they don't ditch the broth and focus on how the fish and the sauce pair together effortlessly..   The second meal I ordered was the filet mignon & lobster tail. The steal was OK. It was dry and over cooked but instead of ordering AGAIN I decided to give it a try... Eh. I should've sent it back! The lobster was the highlight def. it was tender and cooked perfectly.   Suffice it to say, I'd give them another chance and try some other options on their menu. Although, for a steak house to send out a dry over cooked steak requested medium, that's a pretty tough blow.! I think there's a fine line between being a restaurant that can handle volume & being one that produces decadence with every plate served.

If u make a reservation plan to wait 15-30 minutes longer. We made a 7:45pm reservation & were not seated until 8:15. If you like a good steak it might be worth the wait. Just don't plan on a movie after.
My husband and I love going here. The crab cakes are delicious, as is the cheesecake! The servers, especially in the bar, are always so friendly and attentive!
Ruth's Chris quality without the commute ... or the snoot.

My girlfriend and I went for our anniversary. They asked us what was the special occasion because we were dressed up, and we told them it was our anniversary. They congratulated us and asked how long etc. The service was excellent, I never had an empty glass and the food was amazing. I got the pork chops and my girlfriend got the chicken. By far one of the best restaurants. One of the managers asked us what was the special occasion and then asked if we'd like a gift! They gave us a card and a box of chocolates and a card. Overall, it was a nice restaurant. They can at least have real candles for this type of restaurant ;)

The happy hour is great - $6 apps/drinks but the bar area is tiny and can't hold more than 15-20 people.  As a result it fills up right away.  Get there early if going for happy hour.  For the dining room the food is great.  The steaks and prime rib are great.  The prime rib special on Sundays is an especially good deal.  You get a salad, prime rib, a side, and a dessert for $39.95.

The last few visits to Flemings have been a disappointment.  Not sure why so much has changed there - but it has. The steak was a bit overcooked, did not want to complain and put a damper on the celebration at hand - it was acceptable, it also had obvious fork holes poked into it.  The side salad is small, we used to be able to split it, not anymore. The appetizer they serve as a complimentary appetizer was dull - cracked bread with 3 dips that aren't very flavorful. It was noisy, hard to visit. We sat on the main floor at a 4 top table. The Service was confusing, had one person take our order & then it seemed another Server took over, we hardly saw the person who took our order at our table, but saw her at others surrounding ours  - food was delivered by someone else, which is typical in many restaurants - that was acceptable. There was a birthday celebration and the birthday person was handed a little box with candies, which is nice - but not special, in the past, they would serve the birthday person creme brulee -- When we want a special night out again, it won't be at Flemings. Prices do not justify the atmosphere, food or service.

My wife and I had a very nice meal. We both had the lobster/filet combo with Fleming's potatoes. The steaks were prepared to perfection and the potatoes were scrumptious. The lobster was however a bit salty but that didn't take away from a great meal. We both started out with salads and for desert I had the hot lava cake and she had creme brulee.  The service was excellent which added to a great evening.

The steak was okay. A little gritty and not as tender as I'd hope. The Flemings Potatos were terrible! They wern't cooked all the way. Our drinks sat empty quite often. They forgot the butter for our king crab legs and we had to remind them a few times to bring it. For dinner at $150 I would expect better. We wished that we had gone elsewhere.

Came here from out of state with my best friend for our birthday. Everything was wonderful. Made a reservation online. Once we arrived we were seated immediately. My filet mignon was cooked perfectly (medium rare) and my best friend was very happy with her seared ahi. Sides are for the table and we chose the mac and cheese & brussel sprouts. They were amazing. We finished off with the creme brûlée and the chocolate lava cake. The manager came by to check on us (unsolicited)... he offered us a sample of dessert wine along with our desserts. Overall everything was amazing. Our server Byron. He was great.

Great dinner and great service. They do have an awesome happy hour from 5-7, but it's extremely tough getting a spot at the bar area.   Some of the most flavorful and best food! They have Fleming's potatoes and they're so delicious, I'd highly recommend.  Big selection of wine and cocktails.

1st and foremost I will say that the environment is very nice here.   You will get out formal dining areas with high ceilings that requires you to look presentable. This is the ultimate date location when you want to look your best for your husband or wife.  I think everyone knows that you should expect a bill of over $100 here. It's nice to splurge every once in while on a nice bottle of wine or at least an expensive glass or 2.  However, if you are in the 50 to $60 per plate per person range, you don't really get much. I ordered The rib eye and my wife ordered the fillet with a side of brussel sprout.   The sprouts were amazing let me just say that.  The steaks were a little underwhelming.   All we got for the stakes was a plain piece of meat on a white plate. No garnishes, no sauces offered, just meat on plate.   Each was very tasty karma but in a societee where we eat with our eyes, I was a little disappointed.  Perhaps next time we will up our budget to $100 per person and get something we are not disappointed in

My husband and I like to eat dinner early so Flemings happy hour is perfect for us. Our favorite was the pork belly, happy hour price was around 7$. Tonight we decided to drop in there again. We were told they didn't have the pork belly but it was replaced with bacon. So we said great! Bring us one. I stupidly thought it would be priced in the same realm. Nope, 17 bucks. I find that super annoying. I mean the food was good but really? 17$ for three pieces of bacon? It was clear we were there for happy hour, were looking at the happy hour menu. Seems to me something should have been said. I will not be back. The Keg is much better anyway.

For the price you pay, would expect better quality food.  Felt like I went to outback and multiplied bill by 3.   Food wasn't bad, but no where NEAR what they are charging for a meal.  Service is top notch though.

09/01/10  My first, and (so far) only, visit to Fleming's.  I give it 2.5 stars...  First thing I noticed was that it was very dark inside- a pet peeve of mine.  Second, the service looked either harried or aloof.  Where were the smiling faces?  It was 4:15 pm, which meant the doors had just opened 15 minutes ago, and there weren't many guests yet waiting to be seated.  (There were about eight people at the bar area.)  I soon met my server, whose cold gaze and unsmiling face already had me thinking maybe this place was not such a good idea.    After studying the menu, I decided I'd try the Prime Burger for $6. I also asked if I could sample a couple of red wines before ordering a glass of one.  I've been to many venues where this is not a problem, and sometimes, when I can't decide, even willingly offered!  This Fleming's location isn't one of these venues.  My query brought about a more negative change of attitude from my server, but I did get to try two very small samples before choosing a glass.  While I waited for the burger to arrive, I began to boot up my laptop- thank goodness I brought it, bec. the burger took a long time...  The bar area was filling up fast, and the servers started to look even more agitated that I was starting to wonder what was all the fuss?  Finally, just under 20 minutes later, my beautiful burger arrived.  Huge patty, smothered w/ cheese and topped w/ thick-cut, peppered, and smoked bacon, tomato, onion, lettuce, and a pretzel bun.  The one huge onion ring was a nice touch.  The burger was juicy (cooked to my specified medium), quite substantial, and delicious w/ the cheddar, veggies, and bun.  The thick-cut bacon, however, was so salty, that I had to take the slices off!  I was a bit disappointed, since it was such a hearty portion of bacon.  I wouldn't mind having another Prime burger, minus the bacon, for happy hour again, but I'd choose another location.   BTW, as I was enjoying the burger, I finally figured out why all the harried faces and the servers' hustle and bustle-- it seemed like everyone in the bar area had chosen the burger!  The table of six in front of me all had burgers... At $6, it's a steal for diners, but perhaps not expensive enough to garner a nice tip?  Hmm... well, not if the servers' attitudes continue to be cold and distant!

This place is so yummy! The spreads they serve with the asiago bread is to die for! I had a ribeye special with shrimp and scallops and it was delicious! I recommend the blue cheese mashed potatoes as a side! It's very pricey... But if you are looking for a nice dinner out I highly recommend this!

This is my first fine-dining experience.  Unfortunately, I was not impressed. I guess I expected a waiter like SpongeBob when he cleared his mind of everything but fine dining and breathing.  But what I got was just a regularly decent wait staff.  Nothing wrong with that, but I thought there'd be an "experience" to go along with the price here.  Nope.  We had a party of about 18 for a couple grads in the family.  I will say that we were all given good attention by our waiter, and he did a fine job earning his tip.  Its just that there wasn't anything special about the service that you wouldn't find at Applebee's or something.  The food was an experience, though. I had plenty of time to look the menu over a thousand times (late people, I swear).  The cheapest thing on the menu was in fact on the kids' menu.  But we were there for a special occasion, and it was a steak house that featured....steak.  So I would've kicked myself for ordering anything other than steak.  I may have paid $50 for it, but good lord that rib-eye was the best steak I ever had.  No exaggeration.  Like I said, I've never been to a restaurant like this, so maybe that's why I've never had a steak that good.  And I know there are probably competitors for the best steak in Chandler and the surrounding cities.  But for me, this is as good as its ever gotten.  If there is a steak that tastes better than this, I don't know if I could handle it emotionally.  I'd probably start crying.  I don't have to describe it.  If you eat steak, then you know what a good steak tastes like.  This one tasted like tha; probably better.  Flawless.  Of course, all sides are extra.  I ordered nothing but the meat, as I guess I'm a little too budget-minded for this place.  The pop I ordered took the place of potatos or a salad.    People ordered the lambchops, chicken, sliced filet mignon, crab cakes, and some other stuff.  The only complaint was about the french fries haha.  I didn't try them.  I will say that the wedge salads looked great and were very big.  Also, as far as the amount of food you get, the chicken seemed to offer the biggest portion size.  Honestly though, everybody paid so much for their food that I didn't want to ask anyone if i could try their stuff.  It really is a nice place, too...at least I think so.  The lights are dim so people won't see you frown at the prices.  The napkins are fancy...and so are the ones in the bathroom apparently, as my cuz brought one out to show me.  It is not quiet - but not louder than any other restaurant.  From what I read and hear people say, a fine dining place is supposed to be quiet and stuff.  If that matters to you, perhaps this isn't fine enough for you, because its just like any place else volume-wise.  Perhaps 3 stars is stiffing them a bit.  I mean, my meal was perfect...the service was good...and the ambiance was nice.  Am I just too much of a cheapo?  Did I expect too much of an experience for the price?  Maybe.  But I still feel that everything except the steak could have been just a tad better.  If there is ever another reason to go fine-dining, I'm sure I would suggest some place else instead of coming here again.  I saw what they have to offer...and despite the awesome steak, it just wasn't enough to bring me back.

Even though I still think the bar area is lacking, now that I have been here a couple of times for dinner, I have no qualms about adding an extra star. Their steaks are phenomenal! A little pricey perhaps, especially since the sides are all a-la-carte. Oh, but their mashed potatoes are so delicious it's worth the extra money. And they have some great salads, too!  It's the type of place you really want to order multiple courses because everything they serve is great, not just the steak. And even though the beer options are limited, their wine list is fantastic. They have a huge selection, at many different price points. Pretty cool that they also give you an ipad to look it all over.  Even though this place is a chain, it's worth a visit if you are in the mood for a great steak. It definitely beats out the other options like The Keg and Ruth Chris. Get on their email list and you'll get the advertisements for when they do special stuff like give you a free gift cards when you spend a certain amount on dinner. They also sometimes do seasonal pre-fixe meals. Right now they also have a small plate special that will help keep the bill reasonable. Of course, you can always stick to the $6 sirloin burger in the bar. ;0) Just wait until the weather is good so you can enjoy it on the patio.

Excellently prepared entrees with great service.  The steak dishes are understandably the stars of the menu, and on Sundays they have a great special for prime rib: for $37 in addition to the prime rib you get salad, side dish, and dessert.  The prime rib itself is very tender, and perfectly cooked with a choice of 3 sauces to dip it in.  Another good deal is the spring special: Filet mignon and lobster tail with salad or soup, and mashed potato or green beans, for $35.  The filet was also very tender, perfectly cooked, and the lobster was full of flavor, and they will cut it off the shell for you if you desire.  The salmon is also good, perfectly seasoned and nicely cooked.  Service was very attentive, and even though I didn't need it, they offer black napkins to place on your lap if you are wearing something dark so that any lint from the white napkins on the table doesn't get on your outfit.

I stopped by Flemings for a Saturday night dinner with a couple of friends. I had reservations, so even though it was busy, we were actually seated 15 prior to my reservation time. The atmosphere was as I expected, although I was a little surprised that some people dressed more casually than I would have expected.   The service was excellent. The waiter took our drink order and brought a loaf of bread that came with two spreads - both were excellent! One friend and I ordered the petite filet mignon, which was served with Fleming's potatoes. My other friend ordered the regular sized filet mignon with a baked potato. I have never seen a larger potato. My two friends each had a salad - one Caesar and house salad. The salads were each around $9, but good size. The regular filet mignon was $32, while the petite with the potatoes was $26. I didn't really think the regular size was that much larger than the petite.   The steak was phenomenal! I ordered it medium and I can't recall a better steak that I have ever had. It was cooked well, excellent flavor and the perfect size.  The server continued to fill our drinks, brought a second loaf of bread and made sure we had everything we needed.  The total of 3 diet drinks, 2 salads, a baked potato, 1 regular filet mignon and 2 petite filet mignons with the included Fleming potato was $135. Not bad for 3 people. I will definitely come back again.

Less than 6 months ago we visited this Fleming in Chandler and we were very disappointed. While the food was good the place was noisy and it seemed the clientele was not what Flemings is known for.  One would not expect to go to a Flemings and spend $200 on a dinner to listen to screaming kids. The family was out of place and not properly dressed for this type  of restaurant.  I would have gotten up and left but we were too far into the process.   Last nite we went to the Flemings in Scottsdale and was pleased with the experience. The Scottsdale Flemings was the high end experience they are known for.   While we wont return to the Chandler location one would need to decide if they want to spend that kind of money when they can go to Texas Roadhouse or Logan's for decent food costing a lot less and expect to hear kids screaming.   Mgmt needs to decide if they want to be a Flemings or a RedRobin and advertise as such.

I'm a vegetarian and in years past, they've had a great veggie plate option. Tonight I was served an entire head of nearly raw unseasoned broccoli, two halves a roasted tomato, a few stalks of asparagus and a couple ravioli with no sauce. An entire head of broccoli?? Really? Just because I'm a vegetarian doesn't mean I don't know the difference between good food and a lazy, slap it on a plate if it's green kind of dish. For an upscale restaurant, they should know better. All they would have to do is create a pretty plate comprised of the sides already on the menu and it would be outstanding. So disappointed when the rest of the upscale restaurants in the community are showcasing fresh, delicious vegetable dishes, yet Flemings is falling short with a total lack of understanding of anything other than meat. Otherwise, great wine selection, service and I highly recommend the housemade burrata.

Spot on in every category! Food was great, aged steak cook to perfection. Service was second to no one. We go here on special occasions at least 2-3 times a year. Manager even brought us out a gift box of truffles and a $25 gift card when we were done. Maybe they do this for everyone but I liked the touch anyway. Not a fan of potatoes or mac and cheese but I could eat theirs every day of the week.

I took advantage of the AZ Restaurant Week. Reservations for 3 on Open Table for Tuesday at 7:00 p.m. When we arrived we were greeted and seated at a spacious booth. Zoe introduced herself and took our drink and cocktail orders as water, hot bread and butter were being served.   The 3 of us ordered off the AZ Restaurant Week menu (great deal even with the extra charge on certain items). For Starters we ordered the New England Clam Chowder and Caesar Salad. For Entrees we ordered the 6 oz. and 12 oz. Fillet Mignon, and Chilean Sea Bass. For Sides we ordered Fleming's Potatoes, Creamed Spinach, and Thai spicy green Beans. Desserts were Cheesecake and Walnut Turtle Pie which were box up because we were all too full. The steaks were cooked perfectly to our request. The Sea Bass was OK. All the sides and Desserts were excellent.   Service from Zoe was excellent. Food and cocktails were very good. I would definitely be back again. Hint Hint, you save some $$ if you buy the Gift Certificates for Fleming's at Costco and pay with them.

Outstanding food and service.. Steaks were perfectly cooked and the lava cake is to die for. Highly recommend to anyone wanting a great dining experience. Wait staff is highly attentive and really wanting to make your experience top notch..

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here and it was perfect!!!! The service was simply divine and the food was a-ma-zing!!!  The dinner was cooked to perfection and at the end of our meal we were presented with the most delicious dessert!!!!!!!  Truly we had a sublime experience! The ambience was romantic, classy and friendly. It was welcoming and professional at the same time.  At the end of our dining experience the manager brought us an anniversary gift - a $25 gift certificate to use when we return!!!!! I was so shocked and impressed with their customer - centric approach.  I definitely give Flemings five stars and highly recommend others to visit!!!!

Tonight was my Birthday (7/17/2017) and so we went to Flemings to celebrate. Appetizer of Shrimp cocktail came out and it looked and tasted very good. Order was taken for dinner and my wife ordered a side salad as her meal because she wasn't super hungry and decided to add salmon to it to flare it up. I ordered the king crab leg entree but wanted soup to come out first, which it did a short while later along with my wife's salad that was supposed to be an entree. Now the salad, although premature, didn't come out as requested with Salmon on it (as my wife may have considered eating it since it was at the table already) so it was sent back. Soup was very good and flavorful and the servers and assistant were on point as far as pre-bussing and getting refills. Ok, now entrees hit the table. First impression was Blah.... presentation was severely lacking. My wife's salad is really just lettuce with a small filet of salmon on top. Not really much body to the salad and she said the salmon was very bland as she couldn't have butter... but you would have thought the chef could have gotten creative with it despite the allergy to butter/oil. Now my Crab legs, when it was placed in front of me it was 3 small pieces about 6in in length that were halved. That's it, very boring and portion size for amount paid was horrible. I inquired with food runner about the portion size confirming this was my entree and he said yes. My wife and I looked at each other in amazement. Approximately 5 min later or so into the meal one of our two servers came by and said "your other half of your meal will be out shortly". Well that's a relief, but when it came out it tasted like salt water from the ocean and was not edible. 50% of the cost was comp'd. The server also spilled Ice Tea on/in my wife's purse. When we get the bill, my wife was charged $44 for the salmon and I think $12 for the lettuce. A $56 salmon salad that was horrible at best. The salad was more expensive than my crab legs. So Sad, time to find a new place.

It only gets a 3 Star because of the customer service. I would barely give it a 2 for the food. Its been a few years and in another city that I frequented Flemings. Gigi gets 5 stars, she was great. I made reservations months in advance because I was coming to town to celebrate my moms 75th birthday...not realizing it was Restaurant Week. We had a party of 6. The waiter was VERY busy when we arrived at 6:30pm on time for our reservation. He brought us menus and seemed bugged from the beginning. He was not happy when my mom asked for the Pre Fixe menu. She eats smaller portions so why not? 2 ordered off the Pre Fixe menu and 3 of us ordered off the regular menu. (one of our party left because he became ill from travel and dehydration) I ordered the tuna steak which was cut in half, not a steak but a 1/2" LITTLE piece that had been cut horizontally into two small pieces and was $47.00 The others ordered steak and a lamb chop which looked plentiful. We had 3 sides as well as salads and dessert. The food honestly was just okay. Not worth the $375.00 plus 20% tip which I paid but it was not earned. I am really disappointed in Flemings, it was always my go-to steakhouse even though I dont eat anything but fish...thanks for the memories.

Marginal food for very high prices. The fillet had a lot of fat in the bone in ribeye did not have much flavor and was tough. It's not right to charge top prices and deliver such mediocre food. That's the last time Flemings is going to rip me off. Call Dobbs to her tail looked like the size of a crawdad. They are living on their old reputation and I can't pack a couple of times lately hoping for what that restaurant once was.

I am giving this 3 starts,  because the Lady at the Front desk, really needs to drop her Attitude. You don't go to an expensive place like Fleming's, to get Attitude from their staff. If our Money is not good enough to her, we would gladly spend it elsewhere. I told my Husband I wish she doesn't get a share of the tips, because she didn't deserve it. It was Our Wedding Anniversary & we chose this restaurant as we had heard good things about the food. However, the Lady at the front desk was so Rude. She is the face of Fleming's. The first you see even before you have a chance to experience the rest of their staff or their food. Her attitude & rude replies, just put me off. We had a reservation for 7.30 p.m. & thought we would get there around 6.30, so that we can have a drink & hang around for awhile. However when we got their it was packed & the small entrance was full, with no place to stand or sit. I manged to get up to the desk & informed her that we had a reservation. Either she was angry with the crowd their or she didn't like her job. She was just rude & said you have got here an hour ahead. I informed her, that we got there early so that we could get drinks before dinner. To that she just said "Oh! the Bar area is full". We got to the end of the Bar Are, near the back door & with a few minutes wait managed to get the attention of the Barman & get ourselves drinks. I had the 'Club Clover' which was so very sour & didn't taste good at all. I had to ask for some Tonic water in it. My Mum was with us too & she couldn't keep standing there much longer. She is 83 years of age. I saw an empty table Outside & I asked her to sit there & I was seated on the ledge outside. The Tables outside were not being used Last night for Dinner, as the weather was bad. The winds were way too strong, with a slight rain & the leaves were in peoples food. A few minutes later, I went up to the girl in the front again & I asked how long it would be before we get a table.
